comment: I really miss her class, she is the best math professor. She is always ready to teach and willing to help, she is so encouraging and caring. Her plan is clear since the first day, her lectures are to explain everything in the lessons and in the assignments. She is amazing.

I really enjoyed her class, she gives plenty of time for review before exams, and provides practices tests that are very similar to the exams. She's gives great feedback when you ask for help, as well as being very encouraging. Her lectures have a fast pace, so I would recommend sitting near the front.
She is very to the point and talks fast gets through lessons early and is willing to help anyone who is willing to ask. She may not be for everyone but I really enjoyed her class

The best math professor I have ever had She explained everything so clearly and would give extra credit for answering questions and showing up to class. All the homework was graded on the last day, which lets you manage your own time and not stress over due dates.

Prof Shahin is an amazing instructor. She explained thoroughly all examples needed to solve the questions in the assignments & the tests. She is open to any question during class and willing to answer them all. She offered extra credit during class and on canvas. I truly enjoyed her class. Attend class, take notes, do the assignments you will pass.

Professor Shahin is a very nice person sociably but when it comes to teaching I cannot say that I learned much of anything throughout this entire class. I started out in her Math 72 class and ended up moving down to her 62 class because I thought I was struggling too much. Now, I think that it is just her teaching methods-- I didn't get to thrive.
She is an amazing teacher. Thoroughly explains everything. Very encouraging teacher. Highly recommend taking her.

This professor is amazing in my opinion. She goes above and beyond to give good feedback and answer questions. This class is an assignment heavy but the grading is light. As long as you follow the "lectures" and take notes I'm sure it could be an easy A class. 100% would take again.

I loved having her as a prof! She gives some extra credit, patrial credit, and really encouraged me, saying she belieeved in me, when math has always been a struggle. I would've got an a if I studied more for the final. Ask questions, show you're trying, and really apply yourself! I'm taking her for Math 72.
Truly enjoyed taking her class. She is a great teacher and wants her students to pass. She does speak a little bit fast but doesn't mind going back if you did not understand her.

Great professor! She is super nice and kind, you can tell she loves her students and loves teaching. She is very thorough, copy what she puts on the board in your notes. But make sure you ask questions to anything you might not be understanding, and also use the digital book to help you as well.
Great Teacher... really cares about her students, truly wants to see her students pass. Even though I hate math I still enjoyed coming to class.. only struggle was waking up @ 8 am

I was surprised I didnt do well in this class. I passed every test but the Final exam. Unfortunately, any extra credit you do is only applied if you pass the final. Who knows what my grade would have been if I had gotten just 5+ points on the final. The average of the tests were 50% and everyone seemed to be at a different level. PRACTICE!!!!

I've taken two classes from Prof Shahin, and I wouldn't change anything. Great instructor, and loves nothing more than to help students when they have questions. Gives ample time to complete homework, gives exam reviews, and generally cares about her students. As with any math class though, effort must be put in on the students side to pass.

Great teacher. I was a little nervous the first week because of her accent, however, I quickly adapted and thrived in her class. She works with every student until they understand. She is a great teacher, I wish she taught math 146. Tons of extra credit. I got a 4.0

She has to be one of the best math professors that I have ever had. During summer quarter there are 2 tests and the final. If you pass the final your good, she does talk fast but is willing to awnser any questions you have. Unlike most professors Ive met in the past she wants ALL her students to pass. Math is my weakest subject, she made it easy.

She is one of my favorite professors on campus. She really cares about her students learning the material and tries her best to help you pass. She does go a bit fast in lecture but when asked to slow down she does. And if you don't understand something, she will stop and try to help you. She is willing to answer any problems at any time.

Shes a super nice teacher. Yeah she does say excellent a lot. Besides this you can tell she really cares about what shes teaching. I agree she does talk fast at times but shes still a pretty good and caring teacher. I love using the my math lab instead of a textbook.

jumana is an amazing professor. while she does move fa,st she is more than willing to stop and go back and explain anything that is needed, as many times as needed so you understand what you are doing. she uses the word "EXCELLENT" all the time which is awesome, makes me feel like im getting it. its great to have the added confidence boost.

Don't get me wrong, Professor Shahin is really nice. The problem is SHE TALKS EXTREMELY FAST! She doesn't explain how to do things... she just kind of does it and expects us to follow along. Also, she says "excellent" WAY TOO MUCH. Also says "yes or no? Yes" a LOT but says yes without getting any feedback first or actually confirming we understand.
I would recommend her, and I would take her again if she teaches math146.
I really enjoyed her class, she is nice and excellent teacher, and willing to help anyone anytime.

I would recommend her. she is amazing, nice and respected, and gives a lot of extra credit, and make sure her students understand the lesson. I would take her for all my math classes that I have to take for my degree.

Jumana Shahin is the best math teacher I have ever taken. Beware of the tests, she makes them a lot harder than the final. The final is very easy to pass. Know that you only have to pass the final to pass the whole course. I barely used my book because all assignments are on MyMathLab. Just buy the code and you will be fine.

Very helpful and trully cares about her students passing the class. Provides more than enough problems during lectures to have concepts drilled into your brain. Offers lots of opportunities for extra credit. Doesnt use Canvas - uses My Math Lab insted. She does have an accent but it doesnt get in the way of her teaching.
Wasn't too impressed by her teaching skills. A lot of homework for a class that is on a lower level and the tests were very hard. Would not reccomend.
She is understanding and very willing to help.  She's a smart teacher. She's one of my favorite teachers at CBC. She smiles a lot even though sometimes students were being rude.
Really enjoyed her as a teacher. She's a really nice person, she has a sense of humor and she is willing to help anyone in the class at anytime with a question or concern.

Math has always been stressful and anxiety-inducing for me, until I had Mrs. Shahin.  She is an EXCELLENT teacher and truly wants students to succeed.  She is willing to work hard & help you try different methods of solving a problem; basically, she's willing to help you learn in the way that most makes sense to you.  I highly recommend her!
Great instructor. She's always eager to help and responds questions and emails very quickly. One of my favorite instructors so far.

She is a great instructor  The class is easy to follow with her constant instructions and directions online  Will post all needed material for the tests She will answer all questions and responds to emails quickly I'll recommend her if you want online class.

Mrs Shahin well prepared She does have an accent but it's not terrible you can still understand her lecture She prepares you for the tests with a lot of review and practice If you want to pass do your homework and attend class

Mrs Shahin well prepared She knows the material  She cares about her students and always asking us if we understand the material and if we have any question She does have an accent but it's not terrible you can still understand her lecture She prepares you for the tests with a lot of review and practice If you want to pass do your homework

Talks extremely fast and her accent makes it a bit difficult to understand what she is saying.  Often times she contradicts herself, it makes it seem like student is teaching. Easy homework, except test & written assignments. Final isn't what she prepares you for.  She is a great caring person though, just not as a professor.

She tends to explain fast, hard to keep up when taking notes. Even though homework is online get the book, you'll need it. Asked for help and was told to keep practicing. Need 65% or better on final to pass class. About 15 online assignments, 2 written and 2 tests, 1 final. Attend every day if you want to pass.

About 10 -15 online homework assignments and 3 - 4 written homework assignments, 40 - 60 questions each . The final test is heavily weighted, so all the homework helps you practice and be prepared.  She is willing to answer any questions and will go over it with the class in case others are having similar difficulties.  Very helpful, but goes fast.

It's nearly the last day of finals week and the final exam is tomorrow (worth 40% of the final grade)... and she has yet to grade a SINGLE assignment. I have no clue if I am doing well in the class and she doesn't answer my emails. I asked her in person about my grade and her response was "no ones failed before so you should be fine"


bruh

Hands down the best prof in math department. Very caring and respectful. One of the few professors who would stay overtime just to help you. attend all lectures (they are kinda boring but very important for participation credit) and labs + submit everything on time = easy A+

Great lecturer who cares more about her students actually learning than penalizing with bad grades. Always willing to walk you through problems and ensure your complete understanding. The final grade was made up of just three take-home exams and she gives you every possible resource to succeed on them, so if you do not do well that is on you. 5/5!

I love June!! Super sweet and nice, if possible, take her not only for lecture, but for recitation as well. She grades very lenient, and is super understanding about not being able to attend lectures and/or quizzes if you have a good reason for doing so.

MATH 410 is very easy and Gordon just gives you all the code in the labs. Very quick and easy A with little effort required. Definitely a "gimmie" and "pick me up class" to boost the GPA. Attendance is required at lecture but just switch on and off every week with a friend and take turns signing each other in since the lectures are pointless.

This class is super easy, but you will not know your grade in the class until the final grade is submitted. Professor Gordon is a very slow grader and took a month to grade the first exam. On top of this, grades for the first exam were not released until after the week 7 withdrawal deadline, so you could not drop the class if you were failing.

Prof. Gordon is one of the nicest professors I have ever had. She is extremely accomodating, understanding. If you just do simple things like attending class, asking questions, and just interacting with her, the course will be very easy for you. Lectures are not the best I have ever seen but her slides are good enough for self-study.

I took for Professor Gordon for MATH 221. The class was very easy, with 2 exams and a final as the only grades. These exams all took problems directly from the textbook, and she also gave them as take home problem sets with two weeks to get them done. Her lecturing wasn't the best, usually just reading from slides.

I took this class as a 2 hour and 50 minute math. It seemed extreme but in reality it wasn't bad. Professor Gordon makes math so easy and splits up the long math class so it seems short. She always lets out early. No My Math Lab the only grades are 3 exams. She gives exam study guide that is the exam exam with different numbers! Definitely take.

June is great! She is so sweet and nice. A lot of students do not try hard enough in her classes and complain about her teaching style... You need to do work outside of class for math! Practice makes perfect. Her lectures are great and easy to follow. I got 100% in 183 cuz I listened in class and studied a LOT.
good

Prof. Gordon makes math very bearable. She plans out the course to give the perfect amount of time to all topics, with plenty of review.  She isn't very interactive in class, which I actually prefer, but is very approachable if you need individual help. I always had her for a night class, and she always let us out early which was a plus!
Awesome professor. Very nice and willing to review whenever something is misunderstood. She is so great for students who are not particularly interested in the subject.
I hate math, but she made it a lot easier! Taking her again for my next math course!
She is very nice and helpful. Gives out study guides for tests. Grades very easy, no homework. Awesome class for Math.

One of the best teachers at Drexel. She is so easy and the reviews for her tests are pretty much her tests, just with different numbers. You really only need to go to class the week before the test so you know how to solve each problem on the test. She's awesome.
Almost every test was take home.
If your not good at math this course is hard!  But she is a fair teacher and does a great job teaching the course.  TAKE HER!
The Best
Very fair and understanding.  Really goes over the material fully.

If you have absolutely NO prior experience in tech or in programming, Professor Boady is the one for you. The class is hard itself, but his lectures are so easy to understand. I wish they were recorded. I will say this, don't let ChatGPT do all of your assignments or you'll be in a tough spot. Love this professor
Lectures can be long and a bit boring, but the professor is caring and overall.

Boady cares about the material a lot, but sometimes gets carried away and lectures for longer than necessary. He's also a bit quirky which takes some getting used to. However, at the end of the day he cares about the course and his students' success so it's hard to hate on him. Take this course with Boady or Earth and you'll be fine either way.

Quarter Class Taken: Summer 2022.  Professor Boady is a great professor to have for this course.  He has a certain mastery over the material and is able to communicate it well.  Likewise, he does a fantastic job illustrating concepts with actual coding examples in class.  And no exams, just research papers! Accessible and helpful outside of class.
Great professor

For a class regarding data structures, I have learned so much and expanded my expertise/knowledge after taking this course with him. Explained tough concepts simply and very helpful with understanding material. Homeworks can take time, so it is best to not start them late. Highly recommend you take data structures with Professor Boady if you can.
I walked out of every lecture perfectly understanding the material. Very kind and will take time out of his day to answer any questions on Discord. Homeworks can be difficult but very do-able. GOAT
This class was great exposure to some fundamental computer science concepts. Professor Boady did an excellent job and I would definitely take a class with him again!

One of the best CS professors I've had. Does his best to make lectures interesting, explains clearly, provides lots of examples, and is helpful when asked questions. CS171 itself was very easy, especially if you already know a similar language. Zybooks will grade your assignments so you get immediate feedback, but it can be picky with formatting.

Boady is the best instructor I've had in the CS department so far. He's incredibly knowledgeable about course subject matter, is a great lecturer, and is clearly passionate about his field of study. Always approachable and helpful during office hours or after class. Clear + fair grading system, and I learned a lot in this course - highly recommend!
Great Teacher, his lectures are very clear cut and precise. The actual class itself can be a bit challenging
Welcoming, kind, understanding. Class was very straightforward. Wish I was able to take him for later classes too.
I took Boady for first time in cs 260, and I found my introduction to him to be welcoming. His lectures were clear and it understandable well enough for a non-cs major like myself.

The best professor I have had for sure. Mr. Boady cares for his students and does an amazing job teaching his students the concepts. He gives great slide which are very useful in understand what he is teaching and can be used to implement in the homework. If you ever see Mark Boady teaching a class, I would highly recommend taking him.

Professor Boady is a really good professor capable of explaining things well. While not quite as in-depth as I would like, the range of content covered is rather wide and is easy to follow. I would recommend taking him.

Dr. Mark Boady is great. This term, if you did badly on the midterm, you had the opportunity to regain points if you clearly showed that you understood the concepts you messed up when you worked on either the prior homeworks or labs. It's really a novel idea and I think it works really well.
Excellent professor! Seriously one of the best!
Great professor! His lectures were always straight to the point. And overall very nice guy.

Awesome guy and an awesome professor. Teaches very well and is very happy to do so. He's also very understanding and accommodating. The class has a lot of work and I did well for most of it despite having no prior experience. Midterm was a breeze, but the final was very difficult for me. Still would 100% take again. You won't regret it.

He was super enthusiastic about computer science. I liked using zybooks because you get an automatic grade during midterms and finals, and can change your answers as many times as you would like during the time. It was a good amount of work, but if you have to take 171 I'd take it with him.
Best professor in the CS department. Makes the topics reallly clear and the assignments are very reasonable in difficulty. I learned a lot from his lectures.
Goated AF

I loved Professor Boady for 171. I won't say the class was easy-easy but if you actually do the reading homework it is a completely reasonable and doable challenge. He cares that you learn and in our first lecture (it was online) he showed us his cats. Would take another class with him again. A delightful professor though the lectures are long.

he's a great teacher who loves what he does. In lectures, all he does is examples of code. This is sometimes helpful, but I found it to be tiresome after the first few weeks. His class has lengthy weekly readings and homework assignments. They get exponentially harder as the term progresses. He is open to help outside of class. use the CLC for help

Prof. Boady gives VERY clear instructions and grading rubrics for his assignments. He is also very communicative, sending out weekly reminders of assignment due dates and lecture topics. He is reasonably flexible when it comes to deadlines. Overall, this is a professor who obviously cares about his students and I appreciate having taken his class.

The class was interesting, and the lectures never really bored me. I enjoyed taking this class, as it felt extremely rewarding to solve the problems/proofs. Boady gives a lot of helpful hints in the lectures, and I recommend attending the lectures. The TAs were helpful, as well as Boady himself.

Honestly, he is not the best lecturer but, still, a very good teacher. He tries his best to make students actually learn instead of bombarding them with information. Also, he is quite accessible outside of class. I have nothing specific to say for this class. Overall, it was an amicable experience.

Professor Boady is probably one of the best, if not, the best professors in the CCI department. I recently got the chance to ask him how he goes about making his assignments and basically, he gives a ton of thought on it. He tries his best to make them not too easy, and not too hard. He succeeds in doing that and providing help.
Extremely hard process just to submit one assignment.

Prof. Boady is a professor who is passionate about what he does and very clearly cares about the future of his students. He is helpful and insightful when questions are asked and will often go into even greater detail when they are asked than was done in regular lecture. He is understanding about mishaps or mistakes that may occur and seems to have
Very enthusiastic and helpful teacher, he explains the material very well.
Fine. I didn't enjoy anything in particular about his class but, as a whole, it was a pleasant experience.
He's the best professor I've had so far in CCI. His lectures are... interesting, but entertaining. I look forward to his class each week.
Nice professor, easy to get an A as long as you do all your work.

Boady is a great CS professor. Everything is very clear, he knows what he's talking about, and he is a very fair professor. He does have a slight speech impediment, but it doesn't take away at all from the class.

I've never written a review on here before, but I had to make an account to give professor Boady a review. He is easily the best CS professor I have had so far at Drexel. He legitimately cares about his students, and does everything he can to help them succeed. If you put in the work his class will be an easy A.

The lectures might be sluggish but if you approach him after class, he'll really help you out. Really approachable dude with a caring attitude towards his students. Teaches you complex stuff in an easy way and makes sure you understand them. Tests/labs are extremely relevant and only ask what's taught. Overall: 5/5 Total bro. Keep it up Dr. B :)

One of the best professors in the department, but that's not saying much. Clearly explains topics and breaks them down into small chunks, which you then practice repeatedly. This is really the only real way to learn. He's one of the few CS profs that cares about you learning (without being too easy) instead of making you struggle.

Prof. Boady is one of the best professors I've had. He really makes himself available outside of class for any questions that you may have. If you're not the best in CS and you want to work, he'll extend the help that you need to get you to where you want to me in terms of performance. All around great professor, highly recommend.

Mark Boady is hands down the best professor you will ever have at CCI and CS classes. He is caring of his students and a gives good lectures and explains well (if you pay attention). If you pay attention during the lecture, the labs and homeworks won't end up being too difficult and you'll understand the material thoroughly for quizzes and exams.
You will be hard pressed to find an easier proffessor in the CCI. Despite his obsession with groupwork he is an okay teacher too

Boady is a funny and bright professor but his class was tough for non-majors. His powerpoint slides were really lacking in example code, so if we were doing homework, the slides would not be a very helpful reference point. I ended up resorting to stack overflow for help a lot. Not terrible, but make sure you brush up on general programming first.

Boady is a gem. He's very enthusiastic during lectures, but he has some sort of accent or lisp. It can get hard for me to understand him but he's like a meme. His class should be an easy A, but his quizzes and tests are rough. They're either really easy or really hard. His extra credit readings definitely will bring your grade up, so do them.
Hands down best professor I had. Took him for CS270, mid-term was online, really easy. Quizzes are easy too. HW guaranteed 100. Final he probably curved like 20 points or so lol.

His lectures are pretty boring and tedious, but you have to attend them. You also have to use an online textbook, which I think is pretty helpful. He gives a good amount of extra credit, which can easily boost your grade up by a whole letter grade.

I had him for CS 171 programming I. Easiest class I ever had in Drexel. He gives you so much extra credits that my final grade was way above 100. The mid term is piece of cake if you are an average programmer. Final isn't that bad too. If you have him for this class, you just won the lottery ticket!
Good professor!

First CS class at Drexel (I'm an Econ Major). Pretty good overall at explaining topics, if you can managed to pay attention the whole time- his lectures do get a little dry. Homework and Labs are probably where I learned the most, because I would get distracted in lectures. Pretty forgiving and fair
Professor Boady is fair. He is approachable and cares about his students.
Boady is great. He is really good at explaining the topics and makes it easy.

Boady sure is an interesting character. Lectures are, ummm, interesting to say the least. The class is easily passable without going to lecture, most of the content is learned in lab and through homework.

He has a firm grip of the material, just doesn't explain it very well. His class is pretty easy though. He grades fairly and if you are capable of learning some things on your own you will do fine. He pronounces his 'r's like 'w's though...

He is amazing! His lecture is a little bit boring, but if you ask him after class, he can interpret things very clear for you. He doesn't curve the grade, but his grading policy almost ensure an A if you pay attention, and he gives sample final which was very similar to the actual one. In the end, 1/2 students get an A or above.

This dude is boring. I skip all his lectures. He waste 2 hours explaining a concept that could easily be done in 10 minutes. Self study all the materials and I got an A+. His grading scheme is awesome though.

He is a great teacher! 2 hour lectures are just long in general, but I think most people did not enjoy them because intro CS content is just dry in general. His grading policy is guaranteed to get you a good grade in the class if you just try. He was always prepared for lectures and posted content online quickly. Awesome guy :)

In my personal experience, Dr. Boady is a great teacher. As long as you pay attention, you'll learn. I notice most people don't pay attention in his class, whether they're on Facebook, YouTube, etc., and they're always the ones who complain about their "bad teacher." Boady's INSANELY nice and is ALWAYS smiling. It's incredible. I liked him a lot.

If you take him for CS 171, be prepared for the most mind numbingly boring 2 hour lectures you've ever experienced. Pretty much everything is taught from powerpoint slides and concepts like recursion are not clearly taught. I came in with prior knowledge and ended up tutoring my lab partners, since the TAs weren't particularly helpful either.
I wish someone had told me how horrible this teacher is. He doesn't deserve our tuition money. Never taking this classes again.

Worst person I have ever met in my life. Up until now. Is ready to screw you in every way possible. Won't be taking his classes again. Cannot answer when cross questioned. Teaches like a robot from slides.
Class is pretty hard but Klimas, does a great job answering questions, and offering help, for students who express concerns.
Her lectures are amazing, notes are always posted outside of class, along with numerous resources for examples and extra help. Goes over homework problems in class, drops two lowest quizzes.
Easy class just do the homework and if you have any questions take a few samples and ask the professor to help you, they're awesome to work with. Also don't procrastinate...

Caitlin is amazing I love her class so much! I took her for 116 and 117 and would love to take her again in the future if possible. She clearly explained material, posted notes for each class, and took time to go over homework problems we did not understand. I genuinely enjoyed the class and I highly recommend.
Dr. Klimas is a great profesor.
A great prof! She really cares about her students and is thorough in explaining concepts. Take her if you can.

I had her for both math116 and 117, would definitely take again if I can. Very nice and understanding professor. Made it very clear and easy to understand throughout the lecture. Very easy to get a good grade if you pay attention and ask questions.

Review for Math 201

One of my favorite professors. She is very kind, incredibly accommodating, and does a great job explaining difficult topics. My only complaint would be that sometimes she doesn't place enough emphasis on certain things in lecture, but she absolutely makes up for this with her ability to explain things when asked.

Definitely the best professor I've had at Drexel so far. She's amazing at breaking down concepts and thoroughly reviewing the material. She actually cares about whether the students understand or not.
Caitlin Klimas taught a great intro to calc course. I had her for 116/117. Very caring and wants you to suceed.

Caitlin Klimas is one of my favorite professors ever. She clearly explains everything and is flexible with questions and finds way to get across the lesson as in-depth but concise as possible. She is hilarious and very organized. Everything you could hope for in a teacher.
Caitlin is very nice she has great notes online and is always available for help.

This is one of the best introductory Calculus classes I have ever taken. The professor gives many opportunities for extra credit and shows genuine care for her students' success. I would absolutely recommend her to anyone taking Calculus. Just attend class, pay attention and you will succeed!!

She is a great professor, very sweet, and so helpful. I would have loved to take her for every math class because she urges people to go to office hours and gives great and understandable lectures during class.
Same as 116, clear lectures with notes projected on the board. Extra credit offered for doing practice problems. Nice teacher who enjoys joking and wants students to be interested and learn a lot.

Great professor. Gives an amazing introduction to calculus. Notes and examples are written on the board and all notes are posted online. There is not too much work for the class, but it's not difficult. Extra problems offered for more practice. Encourages students to go to office hours. Spends ~20 minutes per class covering questions on homework.

Quarter Taken: Summer 2024. Prof Valerstein has a great command over the material and articulates the concepts and principles extremely well. Concrete examples in class with live programming. Before delving into actual patterns he does a great review of SOLID. Allows resubmissions on homework. Very strict time limit on exams though. Very helpful !

Prof Valerstein expects you to be a professional and put in the work it requires to understand the material he is teaching. His feedback is meaningful and prompt. He is more often than not always available to help via slack/discord. If you are a serious student you will really appreciate prof Valerstein. I highly recommend him.

Professor Valerstein's courses have been the most valuable and industry-relevant of any I've taken in CCI. Assignments are regular and range from fairly challenging to downright trivial, but both courses I've had with him have been well designed and progressed logically. He's extremely responsive through email, and is quick to grade. No complaints.

The professor is extremely challenging with strict grading, often on untaught material. Quick feedback, but minor errors can lead to severe penalties. He often comes off as disrespectful during class discussions and when questions are asked. Requires significant time commitment and self-study to be successful.

Being new to CS, I found Prof Valerstein's software development courses to be the most valuable in honing my coding skills so far. You learn the right way to do things. He has high expectations, which unfortunately are sometimes vague. But, if you're assertive in asking plenty of questions and give yourself time for the hw, you'll learn so much.

TAs were literally giving away answers, because they believed we had no chance otherwise. You will be expected to learn everything on your own (Java, Git, etc.), but at the same time you must figure out the exact design of the project that they created. Whenever I reached out to Boris, he offered no guidance besides vague, two word suggestions.

this course is objectively useful, it teaches many important concepts when it comes to software development. The java learning curve can be managed with some work and dedication. But, I have never had a professor be this condescending to students. His conduct promotes a very unhealthy and snobby work environment

This class is so unnecessarily difficult and the grading scheme is awful. You can have a program that functions as required, but end up getting a 50% because a certain aspect of it wasn't how they wanted it to be. Boris is a smart guy and can be nice, but I feel like he takes pride in how difficult the class is, which promotes a toxic workspace.

Lectures are important to attend and participate during but recordings and slides are available for access. Requires a lot of independent research for those who are not familiar with Java and grading on assignments and labs are extremely harsh. Responses to questions on assignments are short and vague. Plan to spend 10-15 hours on work weekly.

This review is for SE181 not CS504. SE181 is a terrible course no matter the instructor but he isn't making things easier. Assignments are hard and you lose a lot of points for no reason. They arent very educational either. He is making the class harder for no reason and is arrogant. SE181 clearly needs improvement and avoid this course if you can.

SE 181. He is making this class stupidly difficult on purpose. He made everything due on SATURDAY NIGHT. If you have other work to do during the week it pretty much ruins your whole weekend. Both him and the TAs grade like they are trying to fail you. He thinks he is all that, when in reality he is making students lives miserable for no reason.

[For SE181, not CS504] Many people dislike this course and Boris knows that. He insists that he tries to make it better but won't fix the actual problem. If you want a hint, just check the reviews for any professor who has taught this course. This course is harder than SE310, which is what you take after you get at least a C in this course.

Prof. Valerstein is definitely a capable Computer Scientist and I felt that I gained appreciable savvy surrounding Object Oriented Programming principles in the course of the quarter. However, as stated in another review, he does make things difficult for the sake of being difficult at times and his dry sense of humor can be grating at times.

He's a good professor but tries too hard to be hard if that makes sense. The project compounded, which was nice, but it was basically a useless project. I wish he'd tailor it to something more relevant. For reference, the project was KWIC then SE design patterns applied. He comes off as arrogant, but hopefully that changes with teaching experience.

I'm not sure why he is rated so high because most of his lectures were not useful. This course meets 3 times a week. (MWF.)Mondays are recorded lectures. Tuesdays and Fridays are mostly discussions. He mostly came to class late but it did not bother me.

Dr. Tyler was a great psychology professor, and it was clear he was proficient in the field. He always was there to help you after hours and make sure you understand the material. The discussions are very helpful and fun to attend so make sure you set aside time for that. He is very relaxed and you won't regret taking his class.

Professor Tyler is very knowledgeable and can efficiently relay concepts and information. The course itself is not super easy and you do have to read before lecture or you will be lost. Took this class during self isolation so lectures were all pre-recorded and live sessions were optional, but I was still able to learn a lot. Exams noncumulative.

Dr. Tyler is a great Professor. He uses lectures, quizzes, and exams to test our knowledge. The textbook was helpful and its free. As long as you read the textbook for quizzes and study the lectures for exams, you should be good. During the Q&A sessions, hes funny and knowledgeable.

This class is one you don't need to attend to pass. He spends his classes lecturing from a powerpoint that is on his blackboard, never anything more. There is 3 exams, none cumulative. They were easy and straight out of the lectures. You do weekly online homework quizzes which are out of the book, which you don't need, because there are quizlets

Professor Tyler was funny and a great lecturer. Classes are large but attendance isn't mandatory (and a lot of people take advantage of that). Read the textbook, do the quizzes, study slides/the textbook/practice questions for the tests, and you will be just fine. He clearly knows what he is talking about and seems eager to help.

Professor Tyler made going to lectures a privilege. He is clearly passionate about psychology, as evidenced by his anecdotes, willingness to answer any questions, and helpful examples. The only problem I ever saw was sometimes this would be to his detriment. He would sometimes go down psychology rabbit holes, slowing down the lectures a bit.

Prof Tyler is a funny and knowledgeable teacher. However, he spends way too much time on cognitive development/child psychology for a 101 class. We have to remember an unnecessary amount of terms/people. As a business student, I am required to take psych101 (waste of time, pointless), so this was even less relevant to my major.

Such a great lecturer. He is funny, and tries his hardest to involve the class as much as possible. This was my first time taking PSYC, and he made it very understandable. Quizzes are online, and on Quizlet, but all exams are in person. He supplies practice exams which have questions/answers that will be on the exams. Offers lots of extra credit!

The textbook is not needed but you really should get it to study. All quizzes were online, but he's the only teacher who makes you come in for the midterms/final which really can hurt your grade. Be sure to do the extra credit... it raised my grade 3%! He is a really funny guy and makes great jokes through his lectures.
He is very humorous and encourages group participation. Lectures are based off the textbook but all that is needed to do well on the tests comes from the lecture powerpoint.

Dr. Tyler was a good prof, but he is so boring in class and makes you show up to exams (most teachers just give them online). I wouldn't take him again but if you're interested in psych, he is really passionate about it and is very experienced. Also, we had the opportunity to have 6% points added to final grade so that was very helpful

He is a new professor at Drexel University. He was a pretty easy teacher and it seems like he wanted us to do well in the class with all the opportunities to raise our grade. We had some homework assignments and 2 online quizzes so take advantage of those because they will raise your grade. Exams were not that hard as long as you study and keep up
He's really nice to look at but didn't really seem like he was too interested in teaching the class, hence why the T.A. did most of the work.  He's not even teaching at TU anymore

Professor Tyler is such a cool guy. He is really funny and tries to keep class interesting. He uses some of his personal experiences in class and offers extra credit. A midterm and a final, 3 skills lab that you turn into a paper, and a group project. Easy A

He's a young, good looking guy, and he's really nice and easy to understand. It was a big class, but he still managed to get people to speak up and participate. Bring your computer, because the power points are online and he adds additional notes to the ones on blackboard that he doesn't always cover in class. Very friendly, helpful, and cute :)

Definitely can be a gpa killer if you take a 100 person class with him. He does teach very well, but there can be ambiguity in what can be on tests. Study all the time, and should be able to do well. A lot of content is introduced for a general class. Overall an excellent professor to take it with.

The class was long (2:30), so it can be boring. However, the class itself is kinda interesting. Trims down information to study, so the powerpoints aren't that overwhelming in my opinion. Few extra credits are from the text, but if you just study the slides, you can do well.
Easiest class. Takes a really long time to grade anything. Funny stories, boring class. Bring your laptop and have fun.
Prof Tyler is a great teacher. He is pretty chill and kept the class interesting.  Test are just 50 multiple choice and are pretty straight forward. Definitely take him.

Tyler was a wonderful professor. Took the Wednesday class for 2 and a half hours and I rarely got bored. Used powerpoint and posted the slides on blackboard. Attendance isn't mandatory but helpful. Tests are 50 multiple choice questions and they weren't too bad. Study and read the book and you'll be fine. Definitely take him!
Great teacher, explains clearly, responds to emails quickly, tells you to read textbook but not important - went through whole class and didn't read it once, 4 tests

Even though this class was 3 hours the time went by fast because Professor Tyler made it fun and easy. The tests are not bad at all and you really don't need the book if you go to all the classes and read the notes.

Class is sometimes boring cause you just go over powerpoint slides that are online anyway. Just memorize powerpoints for tests and you can get an easy A. Dont buy the book! Prof. Tyler is really sweet and tries to make class fun and really knows a lot about psyc. Gives extra credit. 4 tests, 4 small in-class group ass. up to 10 ex. credit pts.

Good grade, never cracked the book. Does not take attendance, but if you come to every class and study only your notes you will get an A. Offers good amount of extra credit for various easy things like attending events, etc. Take this class for a very basic understanding of psychology and an A toward your GPA.
test is kind of hard. Nice teacher

He is so quirky and funny. He's a good teacher, and a pretty fair grader. As long as you show up to class, you'll do well. I never mind going to this class because he keeps things interesting. He's pretty cute too so that doesn't hurt

Very funny and easy to understand. You don't really need to read the book, just go to class and take notes. He puts the slides on blackboard, but he explains more in class. Always helps and answers questions, makes class interesting. VERY good looking. :)
Keeps class interesting, tests are all multiple choice but not the easiest so study hard for them. By the way, he's REALLY HOT
easy class. very attractive teacher. take this class
great teacher.. study for test allittle hard but overall loved him! always there to help

cool teacher, pretty easy, a lot of notes but thats the only thing you do, likes to spice up classes with videos and random activities, 4 tests and a paper, lenient grader, got to bring in notes for the final, goofball-corny sense of humor, nice guy, definitely recommend

Jeremy is awesome. His class is a lot of fun. He loves participation and has a dry but funny sense of humor. I enjoyed his class. He offers a lot of extra credit and gives good study guides. if you know the info on the study guides you will get an A. I opened my book maybe 2x.  if you go to every class don't buy the book

Prof. Tyler is awesome.  Hes so helpful and really tries to make everything interesting. I have it at 8am and its not that bad at all.  He uses power points but talks a lot so you can understand it better.  Tests are pretty easy if you study and he offers a lot of EC!  TAKE HIS CLASS!!

I this at 8AM but its tolerable because he makes the material fun. He's hilarious and cracks jokes and knows that we really don't care about the material that early in the morning. Really helpful and uses powerpoints so you don't need to read the book. Tests are easy if you study your notes and pay attention in class. I highly recommend this class.

Professor Tyler is awesome. He always makes things funny. I have the class at 8 in the morning so its kinda hard to get responses from people, but it definitely wakes me up. He is very nice and funny. He gives a lot of extra credit opportunities and is a fair grader. Believe me, if I can get A's in his class so can you. Take his class!

Professor Tyler is the man! Hes a nice guy and is very flexible and supportive. He offers 15% extra credit points (out of 100%) in the range of the class and often curves his tests. Although his classes are mostly notes, he tries hard to make them interesting. I would highly recommend his class and him as a teacher
Mr. Tyler is an great teacher. His class is easy and some what interesting. He is very understandable and generous with curves and extra credit. I highly recommend him!
take his class he is the best!!
makes tests incredibly hard. Sometimes make a mistake on the exam and gets it wrong himself but is too stubborn to admit he is wrong and screws over the entire class.
He's okay. Might not take again
It says it in his last name, Dr. King is literally a king. He holds great reviews over material and lectures are very easy to follow and engaging, as he asks questions throughout. Love this man fr

Dr. King is such an awesome professor, would 100% recommend taking him for chem. His lectures were always very organized and the examples he did during class were very helpful. When he was asked a question he made sure everyone understood before continuing. Had him for chem 101 also and I can say that the early lecture times are worth it.
Dr. King is a fantastic professor - he is very much available outside of class and happy to help if you reach out. Your grade is definitely reflective of what you put into this course.
Very helpful in lecture and in office hours. Fair grading on tests, lots of partial credit. Lectures are memorable and engaging.

He is by far the best introductory Chem lecturer you can take. His lectures are well-paced, he makes the material very easy to learn, and he posts online recordings of each class which got me through Chem 101. The best part about Dr. King is that he genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed.

He's not my professor but I watched all of his recorded lectures to get me through the course because they're so helpful. He breaks down questions and makes them easy to understand. He's also just a sweet and easy going. His review sessions are extremely helpful. Could not get through 101 & 102 without him.
Great lecture professor for chem

Great lecturer who genuinely wants his students to succeed. Not the best at Chemistry, and still managed to get an A. Also, he does a cookie challenge which encourages students to participate and go to his office hours. If the student quota is met he bakes cookies for the class. What more can you ask for?

Professor King was fantastic both in class lecture and during the exam review sessions. Material was easy to follow and was demonstrated in a manner that the entire class could understand. Additionally, he was very engaging with the class and answered all questions thoroughly. We got cookies too.
His lectures are really thorough and easy to understand and he genuinely wants students to succeed. He is very accessible to answer questions and is an overall great professor!

His lectures were not very helpful and is just practice problems on topics we did not learn much about. He makes the textbook optional but teaches the class as if every student read the textbook before class and knows the material. Some students have sent emails regarding family emergencies or personal matters but he never responds.

Professor King cared about his students and having them do well in class. He always had office hours and also did the midterm review sessions that really do help you fill in the blanks in not understanding the material. The lecture slides and walk through solving problems really do help. He has awesome ties on every day.

Second time taking daniel king, he is very caring and smart. His format of lectures is very student friendly, and he is interactive and knowledgeable if you ask him questions. Def stop in for his office hours!!

Best teacher I've ever had! I hate Chemistry more than anything and suddenly, 1 quarter of this guy's class gets me an A! Really nice guy and patient no matter what your question is. His notes are so thorough, but you definitely have to take note of what he says and does in class or you'll fall way behind. Wish I had him in secondary school.
I loved Professor King. He is very passionate about chemistry and is a very entertaining lecturer. He also includes several practice questions within his lectures.
Dr. King was enthusiastic about Chemistry, and while I found his teaching style mostly satisfactory, I would not take a class of his again.
I love Dr. King so much. He teaches well and always advocates for students to seek extra help when needed. He is also very accommodating if help is asked for in advanced.
This man is the best Professor I have ever had. He is the sweetest, makes great jokes, and is always willing to talk and help.

i like him a lot, if ur confused def start reading before lectures, he more explains the concepts and goes into more detail, and explains concepts. I think recitation is the most important regardless, but if u need help he's extremely accessible and nonweldable. v cute, he is very proud of his ties

I would say he is an amazing professor, although he was not my lecturer for chem 101 or chem 102 I really enjoyed the exam review sessions he would hold for each chem exam. In addition, I would really recommend watching his recorded lectures. I don't think I would have passed chem 101 or 102 lol.

Prof. King is incredible. He makes a point to be incredibly accessible, through office hours and recording each and every lecture. His lectures are really good and interactive, so you get a chance to see what you know. I regret not going to his office hours, as he is a very caring and kind person who has good connections at Drexel.

A real swell guy! He's caring and does a lot of explanations. While Chem seems hard if you put in the time, take his advice, and go to the office hours you will do fine! He does a thing called a cookie challenge. If enough of your class visits his offices hours he will make everyone cookies. My class didn't reach the threshold but its still nice

He is the best. 100% would recommend him to anyone taking Chemistry courses. Outstanding lectures with clear and explicit explanations. He is very caring and supportive. Very accessible outside lectures. Definitely go to his Office Hours because they are the best! Don't forget the cookie challenge !!

Dr. King was an amazing chemistry professor and truly set me up for success. I ended up transferring school and I am in an orgo class right now and I have never been more prepared. Orgo now seems like a walk in the park so far since Dr. King is so articulate and truly a fantastic teacher all around. Go to his pre-exam sessions and office hours!

Dr. King is one of the best chemistry teachers at Drexel. If you attend Drexel, what you will most likely hear is "Chem 102 is the make or break course." Choosing to attend Dr. King's lectures and review sessions was one of the best decisions you can ever make. His teachings are very clear, and he is always able to answer your questions.
A very accessible and knowledgable professor. Make sure to ask questions about the homework because the in-class examples may seem easier.

King is very passionate about what he teaches while simultaneously keeping the students engaged in his lecture. Professors like him are few and far between, which is a shame because he is a stand-up guy. If you have the option to, TAKE HIS CLASS!

Dr. King is a good professor. His lectures are terribly boring, but if you use the resources the department provides like review sessions and practice tests, you will do fine in this class. Don't go to the 2 hour review sessions, they are waaayy too long. They post them online question by question. Dr. King is very helpful in office hours, too.
he was fine, average prof. voice kinda annoyed me but nbd. taught well, answered questions, held review sessions then posted recordings

Awesome Professor almost like being in high school again because if you pay attention in class there is nearly no need to study. If you do still need to study his exams are nearly identical to his practice exams so you will always be able to succeed. If you need extra help he has office hours and will take questions in class.

Overall, a great person. In class, he is such a great teacher. He really makes sure you understand the material by allowing you to ask questions and participate in class. Outside of class, he really cares about his students and wants you to do well. He is accessible with office hours. Gives great advice and is very approachable.
Daniel is a very clear speaker and he teaches in a way that helps students remember.
He is probably the only gem in the Chemistry department. He will explain it very throughouly, unlike the rest in this department. Keep up a good relationship with him, it will come in hand
i stopped going to my chem lectures so i could go to his. his review sessions are phenomenal

He is the best lecturer I had so far in Drexel. I hate chemistry, but he is very good at teaching. Even if I don't understand stuff, I blame myself for not paying attention. Take his Chem class and you will not regret it.

Dr. King is an absolutely amazing professor! His lectures are really clear and he explains extremely well. I took him for Chem 101 and 102 and in 101 I didn't go to all of the lectures and suffered because of that. He's really accessible and an amazing teacher.
usual chem 101 class but he's been my favorite lecture. Hoffman sucks and monica is sometimes hard to understand. I go to King even though I dont have him anymore

Amazing professor. Gets you involved in office hours because there is a cookie challenge if half the class goes to his office. Lectures are insightful and easy to understand. Doesn't need a microphone; he is very easy to hear. Just from taking notes in his class you will feel like you are really mastering chemistry (pun intended).

Dr. King is great! His lectures are amazing and he creates student friendly slides that help you succeed in this class. He always available outside of class whenever you need him either email or go visit him in office hours! Taking him for Chem102 as well.
Very good lectures and prepares you for the tests better then other chem lecturers.

Excellent Professor. I would recommend him to anyone. His lectures are actually interesting and in high school I used to hate chem. You can tell he cares about us and wants us to do well. The tests are generally pretty easy.. just study the practice exams. Not to mention he's adorable and went to Johns Hopkins for his undergrad... super smart.
Great teacher, he's so normal and easy going. Lectures are easy to understand and I like his cookie challenge.

His lectures for my class were a little behind the others, so he moves kinda slower, but he really makes sure you understand it. Also he bribes you with a cookie prize if a certain amount of people come to office hours,so he really wants you reach out. If you need help he's super helpful,his practice exams really help you prepare for the real thing

Amazing man with strong tie game. Great lecturer and adorable, best professor I had all of freshman year. Do your best to get him for CHEM 101 and 102 and go to the review sessions for the exams - worth it.
Dr. King was fantastic for both CHEM101 and CHEM102. I highly recommend trying to get him as your lecturer (and go to his study sessions). He's a really good guy, very accessible, funny, and helpful.

In my opinion, the best lecture professor in the department. Gave the best lectures I  have had in Chemistry ever. Keep up with the readings and go to every lecture and you will see the results of his teaching on the exams.

Taking him again for Chem 102 because he was that good. I expected my grade to be higher but that was all on me for not studying. He's very helpful when you go to him. Tests are clear cut and the practice exams are very useful. Always go to the study sessions and do the homework. Just put in the effort ad you'll get an A.

The total man. If you dont have him for lecture go to him regardless there is no comparison with the other lecture professors he is the best by far.  If it wasn't for this man I would have not passed either classes. For chem 101 I got a F on the first mid term went to him for the next and got a 92. Is he from heaven? Yes.
BEST CHEM TEACHER EVER! Take his class it's easy A!

Dr. King is a great lecturer.  He explains concepts clearly, although he will move a little quickly on some areas, which requires the use of the textbook to clarify some concepts.  This isn't his fault, its due to the fast pace and amount of content he is required to cover.

Great professor, clear explanation of the curriculum and uses many teaching tools ( clickers, in class experiments) ! His lecture slides are simple and helpful. The review sessions before exams prepare you for the test. I highly recommend taking his class.

Dr. King is definitely the best Chem 101 and 102 lecturer! He is very good at explaining the material and allows good interaction during the lecture. He also offers review sessions for the exam which is really helpful! If you are taking Chem 101 and 102, you should definitely make sure you have him!
One of the best professors at Drexel. Super clear and helpful. I strongly recommend him.

Great professor, knows what he is talking about, holds review sessions, and lecture notes are helpful. Defintely take Dr. King and go to his review sessions. Just a warning though, the exams are tricky but I think you should be fine if you get him.
He is very effective in challenging young minds as well as inspiring every soul to learn. #Clickerzz
I went to his office hours 3 times, once before each exam, and he was extremely helpful and was eager to help me understand the concepts. Such a great professor!

Professor King was just another awesome chem teacher to add to my list of awesome chem teachers, when I found out chem 201 was taught by him I hit the ceiling - soooo happy !! Daniel King is an awesome professor!!!
Best Chem Professor At Drexel University...
Fricking awesome! Clickers rule!

This guy is the best professor I have ever had. He is the reason I switched my major to Chemistry! He cares very much about the students, has natural great teaching skills, knows Chemistry very very well and implements things like the clickers to help students learn. His review sessions are the best things!
Class was awesome. Very interactive and for the first time i actually understand chemistry

Not sure why he has such a high review on here...Notes are often useless and have nothing to do with the exam, and he does not even offer extra credit for work. So when you have 3 exams per term, and do bad on one your basically screwed. The online homework is ridiculous, and just consist of punching in answers until correct.
He is a great teacher! He has a great accent that just makes his teaching like watching a play. Very entertaining and he has a sense of humor.

Great class!! I had him for CHEM 102 and wanted to take another one of his courses. This class is much smaller and the work required is fair. I'd rexommed that anyone take this class because anyone can have or develop an appreciation for chemistry!!
Hes great love him.
Fun lecture class with interactive questions
Awesome teacher.  Clear, organized notes. Always willing to help.  Best teacher ever....he should run a class for other teachers
King is the best chem lecturer at drexel.  He will make you want to attend lecture because its entertaining and you actually learn
BEST TEACHER EVER, TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!!! EXCELLENT REVIEW SESSIONS BEFORE EACH EXAM!!
Amazing instructor. Made chem 101 and 102 a breeze. I highly recommend attending his lectures over the other professors.
Very nice teacher for chem
very smart man
No Comments

Dr. King is one of the best teachers I had this year. He was willing to meet any time that was convenient for me and replied quickly to all emails. His lecture style keeps your attention and his use of the "clickers" allows  you and him to see what percentage of the class is getting the material being covered. Overall, I would high recommend him.
Uncaring

I had professor Addison last term and after having had Dr. King for one day, I can already say that there is NO COMPARISON!!! Dr. King is awesome. The structure of his notes (which are posted btw) are awesome and he makes everything clear!!! I have been to many of his review sessions and found them all very helpful. I'm sure i'll get an A this term

I just got back from a review session with Dr. king- he is without a doubt, one of the best chem teachers I've ever come across. The most relaxing course so far, i did not expect that prof Vokolos was very passion with teaching. The grading was very generous but not too much feedback.

He is my senior design advisor and only advice I would take from him is how to be the most annoying person in universe. Worst professor I have ever had.  Avoid at all costs.  Provides no feedback.  Learning minimal.
This class prepared me for the industry and it doesn't have too many assignments. Overall, this class teaches stuff that you will actually use.
Another amazing Drexel teacher who thinks a good way to run class is to make students read from a book published 15 years ago, and do nothing else.

Everything in SE210 was a group project and the work was INSANELY light. We finished 2-week assignments in about 2 hours. Lectures are incredibly boring, but attendance is not mandatory, so feel free to skip.

Professor had no idea what was going on inside groups and was not very fair while resolving conflict. The course is structured poorly and the final exam felt like an English exam as it focused little on the CS aspect and more on 'what the paper was about?'. Prof. Vokolos replies very slowly and is not very good with technology.

The material was dry and his lectures didn't help. They were directly read off of Kurt Schmidt's slides (so he didn't even make his own lectures) so provided a small amount of info at best. Assignment criteria is never given so points were taken off for things you never knew about. Did the bare minimum. TA did more than him. Do not recommend.
Oh my god this class lecture is so boring I wanna die. But on the good hand, he made class attendance non-mandatory. Great guy Prof. Volkolos.

Vikolos is a very nice person outside of class. He is decently soft spoken, can make you fall asleep very easily. Despite having lackluster lectures, the information is there and the material being taught has a good amount of real world value. Attendance isn't required and assignments are pretty easy which is a plus.

Has him for SE210. Absolutely boring lecture, however it's non-mandatory! Class has only 4 assignment, 1 midterm and 1 final. I study 10 week worth of class within 3 hours. Still got good grade. His curve is generous. Take him if you want something super easy. But his class make me switch out of Software Engineering.

You will not learn a anything in his class. He is highly intelligent with a lot of experience in the field but a hopeless lecturer. Grading is done at his whim with no criteria. He is okay professor not sure about his grading though

I would give her five big Dooms. The individual reflections in a GROUP PROJECT BASED CLASS are worth way to much especially considering they often have nothing to do with anything you do in class. I have more to say but other reviews cover that.
Anybody can be a professor for CI 102 instead of her.

If you love compsi but hate yourself, this class is a perfect fit! She treats college students like high schoolers but explains code like she learned it yesterday. She talks down to us like we just learned what a keyboard is, yet somehow still manages to be wrong half the time. I'd rather debug C code in Notepad than sit through this again.

She is rude to everyone and despite being incompetent herself, will yell at you for doing what you were told to do. She acts as if everyone is a child who can't follow instructions. Lectures are activities so you are not taught anything during this class.
Easy class, the bad rating comes from the fact that she treats us like high schoolers. Assigned seating, not allowed to leave labs early even if we finish, etc.
how is she still not fired yet, I just don't understand

She's so condescending oh my god. She dissmisses everyone's concerns because the course average grade is high. (She told us this). Expectations are NOT clear and this should be obvious given all the bad grades on Activity Reports but she insists they are so that's that.

The absolute worst professor. She treats her class like employees, and is the least understanding person ever. She talks in a weird condescending tone and does not care for students as such. Would highly recommend avoiding her!
Do Not Take! Avoid If Possible
Changes requirements every week

The high expectations set were not matched by adequate support or sensible grading criteria. While aiming for rigor is commendable, the lack of sufficient guidance made it difficult to meet these lofty standards. Additionally, the grading seemed to focus on arbitrary criteria unrelated to the main goals of the course, which was frustrating.

I withdrew from her class because her teaching style was so abrasive. I was in an introductory CS class and she treated it like an advanced program, not teaching basic concepts and dismissing questions she thought were a waste of time.

As someone who's taken Pirmann for both CI-102 & CI-103, she's definitely not as bad as some say. Do know that she is a strict grader and sticks to her syllabus religiously. Honestly, as long as you read the lab assignments and do literally EVERYTHING it says, you'll be chilling. All in all, not the best class but certainly not the worst. Good luck

Look, if your reading this and panicking about all of the bad reviews know that many of them are hyperbole. She's a tough grader, is extremely faithful to her syllabus, and expects students to approach her class the same way they would a real job. Just give the class some care and you'll be fine.

Deducts points like it's Christmas morning opening my presents, but will make it soo difficult to gain points back. Grades dumbfoundedly tuff in the first half of the course dropping pretty much everyone's grade. Class is run by TAs but even they don't know what's going on. Spent more time than in any other course than in this class but got a B+.

THE WORST PROFESSOR!!!!! She is set in her ways, always defending herself, and giving unclear instructions. SHE DOES NOT CARE ABOUT YOU. If you're in high school take AP CS!!!! Avoid her at all costs. You will wish you dropped out of Drexel.

The course isn't hard to pass at all. But, this professor controls the CI sequence including homework and grading rubrics. She is strict in grading, believing in this "go above and beyond", and taking off points for not doing it. She's gatekeeping points that could mean a small enough difference to another letter grade. But, worse does exist.

If you have a choice not to take her, don't. but turned out to be more taxing than CS171. The professor is too set in her ways, non-cooperative, and pretty indeed believes that her course is the only thing important in your life. weekly lab and homework, research paper, & programming project. take 164 if you can.

Piarmann was not a terrible professor but she tend to ramble a lot. She's pretty understanding but she's very stern when it comes to assignments. I'd definitely take her again. She has high expectations for her students but she also understands that most likely her students are new to computing and informatics.

Actually pretty nice when you talk to her one on one but not great in class. Would disappear in the middle of lab and never help anyone with their projects. Doesn't treat the class very well, often criticizes students with zero constructive criticism. Wouldn't take again, but it wasn't awful.

Everyone gives her bad reviews but I like prof. Pirmann. I thought she was really friendly and her class was always fair. As long as you turn in your homework on time and show up to class you should get an A.

I don't think he wants to be an art history professor. His lectures so far are ONLY about religious history/ philosophy. Obviously thats an important topic to cover for art of this time period, but he goes on WAY too long and monotone rants about the religious context of every photo & nothing else about the piece of work. & Big Jordan Peterson vibe

Dr. Gregory is awesome. This class has been my favorite so far at Drexel. His lectures are really interesting, he cares about how his students are doing, and is generous with his time. There are only 4 tests and a final paper, and he lets you choose what art work/artist you want to write about. I suggest going to his online test review sessions!

Awful experience, he made this class so much harder for no reason. After taking 101 with Pia, who was amazing, I expected this class to run similarly. It did not. He does not specify the importance of what he is saying during the lecture. You must go to review the video session to learn what was not in class on tests, which is not fair.

Dr. Gregory rocks. He is brilliant, cares about his students, and is good at helping you see the micro-macro ideas of subjects. I recommend chatting with him outside of class, he always has a lot of interesting ideas to share!

Joseph Gregory works hard to make lectures effective for students learning. If you want to pass, you need to pay attention. He does not allow online notes without an accommodation, but you should still take paper notes. His tests are drop-dead easy, like straight 95+ grades if you go to lectures and the review sessions.

Joseph Gregory's class is great. Lectures can be boring at times and often he teaches more than is necessary for the quizzes, but he does not give homework and the quizzes are pretty easy as long as you have a basic understanding of the content

The class is lecture-heavy so if you do well with lectures, take it. Personally, I think he makes the lectures very interesting (storytelling). 3 exams 1 paper throughout the term. They are pretty straightforward as long as you listened in class (writing notes is helpful). Lectures are recorded so it's okay even if you got sick and missed a class.

Very good teacher but I did not like the structure of this class. The way the answers to the test questions are worded make the test tricky and hard to study for. There are only 3 tests that count towards the grade, plus the final paper so it makes it very nerve wracking to fail one test.

He knows a LOT about art, but his lectures are hard to understand. It's hard to tell what is a key point about the artwork that we should remember and what is just a fun fact he decided to tell us, and you can't write down everything he says because he says so much. I did great in Arth101 with a different professor and poor in this class

Dr. Gregory is very knowledgeable about art history and you will learn in his class. However, I found his lectures to be boring and redundant, and the technology ban doesn't help. Attendance taken every class. Grade based on midterm, final, and final paper and he doesn't use BB so you will only get to know the midterm grade and then Banner grade.

Dr. Gregory is an amazing professor for students who are not very interested in Art History initially. The first couple classes are very philosophical which could be boring, but the actual content itself is very interesting. It is like storytelling for each artwork. He gives out HUGE curves for midterm (B to A+). Must take handwritten notes!!!
He is very knowledgable in art history. However, his lectures dragged on forever and we can't use laptops in class! Final grade only consists of a quiz, two exams, and an essay.

Dr. Gregory is the best professor Ive ever had to date. I had him for 102 and just felt like I needed to take him for 103. He is profound, and clearly knowledgeable about the topics covered this course. His lectures provoked a lot of thought in me throughout the class, and i found myself constantly engaged and interested in what he was saying.

I had Dr. Gregory for ARTH 102 & 103, and he knows what he's talking about. Dr. Gregory really has such a vast knowledge of art history. You really have to pay attention because his slides don't have words, just the artwork, name, artist and year. He'll go on tangents about unimportant things sometimes, but I learned so much from his classes.

Dr. Gregory is incredibly pretentious, and I almost dropped his class in the first week because he did nothing but rant confusingly. However, I'm glad I didn't drop his class because his lectures are amazing and very interesting. There are only 2 exams and 1 easy paper, but attendance is mandatory. He is a good prof but not a great people person.

I love this guy! I had him for more than one class, and he is so understanding and chill.  He's the man. If you are going through a bad time, he is so understanding and doesn't put unnecessary pressure on you. He will do his best to work with you.

The professor really knows what he is teaching. The 2 exams are pretty much based on the lecture rather than the textbook. Make sure you go to the lectures and take good notes. The paper is also pretty straightforward too. by the way, he absolutely HATES cellphones so just don't use it during class.

An incredible lecturer with a vast knowledge of the art world. Even if you have zero interest in art history, he will get you interested. Tests and essays are easy if you show up to class as they are mostly based on the lectures rather than readings.

He's a great lecturer and I enjoyed listening his lectures. Outside of the class he was a mess. My friends and I emailed him throughout the term once or twice each and he almost never responded. I asked to meet him to review my essay and he told me to email it to him. I did and never got a response even after asking him after class one day.
Very knowledgeable on what he teach. Would spend extra time outside of class to help students who don't understand the materials. Highly recommended.
Scary smart professor, probably the best lecturer I've met. I couldn't help but wonder why he waste his brain on art, lol. But he definitely can get you interested in the art world.

I've had-have quite the infatuation for dr gregory.  Brilliant, an articulate lecturer.  Knows how to convey the material in a sensible manner. Did really well simply by listening.  I mean, I found him quite easy to pay attention to ha

Okay, hes a really nice man, and clearly very knowledgeable, but he RAMBLES like crazy!! he is easily taken off track, and it makes understanding his lectures somewhat difficult.  I had a 3hr. class with him from 6-9 so maybe i am biased, if i were you, i would look for a shorter class earlier in the day with him, then he is proabably great.

Really hard teacher.  His tests consists of paintings that you never cover in class but he expects you to recognize who the artist is because we covered like one painting by that artist.  If you're not interested in art history, avoid him at all costs.

Whether your interested in art history or not, I would definitely recommend taking class with Dr. Gregory.  It is easy to see that he is VERY knowledgeable and passionate about art history.  He occasionally makes jokes which are very funny, however his lectures can sometimes be boring.  Tests are easy as long as you study.  HE IS EXTREMELY HOT!!!!!

Awesome teacher! Very fair and loves the subject matter; a good lecturer and makes class interesting. Grade based on 2 exams and 1 paper. Exams are easy if you just come to class and pay attention (he doesn't use the textbook much). Gives out a study sheet and tells you what concepts are important to know so you'll do well as long as you study.

AWESOME.  that man made me love a subject I previously had no interest in- and not only b/c he was sooooooooooooo HOT!  (Ask anyone in my class, I had it bad for Dr. Gregory)  He is so passionate about art history, and he always had a new perspective on a piece that everyone thought was definitely one thing, and he always had another explanation for it.  The man is the best art teacher in the whole world!
Wow, I can see Dr Gregory still has it!  It's been a few years since I've been in his class, but I'll remember that time always.  He was the reason I got up early on Tuesdays!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Gregory is far and away the best professor I have ever had. He's brilliant, knowledgable, passionate and, oh yes, very hot (all my friends, except the jealous guys, agree). He has changed the way I think about things, especially images.
No Comments

This is one cultured, intellegent man. He knows his stuff. At first it seemed like the class was going to be boring, but not with this guy. He got me really into art and I learned a lot in that class. I highly recomend this man to all students, not just CoMad kids.
Very intelligent individual. Very articulate. Makes art history fun. I would recommend registering for his classes.
Gregory is very passionate about art, and is very good at teaching because of that.  He certainly is not hot and his classes can be very boring lectures.
He is what college should be. His classes are what you thought college was when you were in high school. Oh yeah ...he's also a major hottie. Take all his classes!!!

HW grading is a nightmare. If you have any experience with coding before and accidentally use *any* of that knowledge before its 'covered in class', the course policy is to give you a zero in that section. 

Completely opaque, mysterious directions that punish you for having previous knowledge or teaching yourself anything.

Professor Medlock teaches comp sci like she's training us for the Hunger Games. One tiny mistake and your grade is publicly executed on sight. She enforces rules with the passion of a mall cop on a power trip, and her grading makes me question my will to live. If you like compsi but hate yourself, perfect fit!

Medlock is honestly not as bad as everyone makes her out to be. She's strict but she has a genuine interest in her students and is willing to help.
