Although lectures are a bit dull and information heavy, as long as you review a little before labs you'll do fine. For homework assignments, make sure you start at least 2 days before the due date.

cs171 and cs172 were so easy. she's very helpful and there's a lot of office hours. even if you don't understand a lesson, there are so many resources (prelecture recordings, office hours, readings, homeworks, labs, even emailing her). going above and beyond for homework is rewarded and lowest grades are dropped. she also always has amazing TAs!

Medlock always described the instructions for the assignments to the best of her ability. She wasn't in charge of grading for the large projects, only the labs which she was lenient on. The course itself has a lot of workload but she always communicated deadlines and was open and helpful during office hours.
Tough class, but enjoyed the professor!

Lectures were incredibly dense, the quizzes and weekly homework assignments were incredibly difficult as well.  It felt as though each aspect of the class (Lectures, Quizzes, Zybook Readings, etc.) were all loosely connected, with them drastically varying in difficulty and subject matter.  Definitely one of the worst intro classes I've ever taken.
RUN!
Rough grader, will take points off for the smallest thing and sometimes will give you a zero if homework isn't done the way she wants.
Very tough in grading and try to minus your score in every minor point. Don't take her.

Professor Medlock wasn't a diffcult teacher, it was just the lecture that made the class feel long and dragged out.  She read off the lecture slides and stops once in a while to answer questions. The weekly quizzes aren't bad, but later on in the course get diffcult. Just do the Zybook and self-learn.

Her lectures are nothing special. I felt like I learned more from reading the textbook though. Her lectures can be kind of boring and it's a little hard to hear her from the back. Also, she goes through the same stuff as her recorded lectures, so you don't really need to pay attention in class. Labs are easy with a friend.

For people that are not familiar with CS, I would say would have a hard time in this class. It goes over the fundamentals of OOP and is of lower to intermediate level coding.
She's not a bad professor, but a confusing one to people that are not familiar with the CS lingo yet.

The prof did her best to help students during labs and class time but the course material was just a lot. It's more of a fault of the class than her, but there was so much work assigned. Start everything early, ask questions, and go to class and you will be fine. There is a LOT of work but the work itself isn't very hard.

I've never met a more incompetent teacher who is unqualified to teach a course. Worst professor at Drexel, you will not learn anything of value. She has no actual experience in her field and she has no idea whats happening. She just gives you pre-made coding problems from a textbook and reads off slides. Easy, but you won't learn anything.
She isn't efficient in explaining topics at all. Her communication skills are below par. She is quite strict when it comes to grading. Wouldn't recommend.

The lectures are long but have lots of information. Slideshows are always posted online and attendance isn't taken in lectures so missing some classes isn't a big deal. The digital textbook has lots of homework and readings, but it's doable if you set aside the time. Not exciting or groundbreaking but fine for an entry CS class.

She is a trial by fire. I did not know code before and after about 10-15 hours a week of trying I could get a really good job just because I took her class. 50% odds of failing, 25% odds of nothing and 25% getting a really good outcome. You are going to spend about 10-15 hours per week for her class alone to get a B-. You learn good python thought
She was ok with over 100 students failing the midterm and called it 'normal'. I withdrew because I didn't know If I could pass the class.

Medlock writes custom unit tests for these ZyBooks exams and labs which are terrible. You spend more time during the lab getting the newline characters to pass her unit tests than writing actual code. Exams are terrible - none of the class finishes due to her terrible unit tests and you waste most of the time writing class definitions versus code.

CS 171 with Professor Medlock was TORTURE!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! Her lectures are examples only, as she expects you to read the lecture slides before class. Doesn't explain anything or stop to explain something in depth; thinks everyone has knowledge of coding when this is an introductory course. Had to withdraw cause the midterm flunked my grade.

The worst class I have ever taken in my time at Drexel. Her lectures are terribly hard to follow/understand. Nothing will prepare you for her quizzes no matter what you try to study/expect especially not the 2 hour final that was said to be cumulative but really not. She was discouraging, students dropped week 9.. that speaks for itself.
She is a good professor. She tries her best to explain the concepts and tries even harder with the tough ones. Her classes are boring though.
Textbook is expensive and useless. Quizzes make no sense and don't contribute to learning at all. Lectures are boring. You are going to have a hard time getting a good grade.

It was my first semester and I almost left Drexel because of this class. You can understand all what she is teaching in class but still not pass her class. A lot of homework. Plus, she doesnt trust her students. If you are new student dont abandon just because of that class .

She does not teach students the way students supposed to learn. She will scare you a lot about academic integrity before every test and exam. She is a tough grader. Get ready to do a lot of homework. She just demotivates student by scaring them about integrity and that way student gets scared.
A lot of assignments are much harder than the lectures and examples gone over

The homework is incredibly difficult. If you dont have a background in CS (I didnt) this will probably stress you out. The quizzes and readings are okay and you might think you understand the lectures but the homework will hurt your ego. I gave up on getting an A after Homework 4.
Extremely dry and boring lecturer, frequently did other work in her class to keep myself awake. Nothing terribly hard about her class, but it certainly won't teach you the joy of programming

Prof. Medlock is difficult to understand and her lectures are long and drag on. She does too much code review when it is very obvious how her code works and takes attendance in the middle of class. Lectures barely pertain to homework or labs, but do matter for the quizzes and exams. If you already have basic CS knowledge, you should be fine.

Do your work and come to class and you will be fine. You have unlimited attempts on homework. Do the extra credit if you are struggling on quizzes/tests. Lots of reading and long lectures but it was fine. She does not trust her students and tends to give out a lot of false academic dishonesty marks for simple assignments.

Poor at speaking clearly whle giving lectures. Doesn't design the cirriculum, but 171 is full of busywork (zybooks is awful, especially if you already know/understand the material). Quizzes and exams are trivial though

This is the worst class I have the misfortune to take. Prof. Medlock seems like a nice professor but her lecture is excessively boring. The class is also stringent in its requirement as if it is designed to fail you. Attendance is also mandatory but almost everything is curved because it seemed impossible for anyone to get full credit.

Doesnt seam very knowledgeable about the field as a whole but is really amazing at reading powerpoints word for word if that is what you are looking for. Also very inflexible and unreasonable when it comes to discussing any issue with her.

Shes okay. It can be occasionally hard to understand her accent but it's not as bad as some of the other professors here. She also likes to go over the time allotted for her lectures. Medlock isn't terrible, but if your taking 171/143 try to take Boady instead. He's the guy that designs the curriculum anyway.

When I took CS 171, Dr. Medlock she had to deal with a lot of students because the course is a beginner core course. So you actually do most of your work you with your lab TA. But her lectures.. They are long, boring and only concentrated on the material. She talks nonstop for the entire lecture time and she never tries to make it interesting.

I had to take undergrad paper class CS170 and online grad course CS570 with her. If you are willing to put the work in, you will come away with a seriously comprehensive understanding of the material and a good foundation for any computer science course. I will say however that she is notoriously difficult in terms of HW and exams. STUDY (3x) WORK!

Economics major like the majority of my class.. I must confess she's a terrible teacher very boring. Hard to understand. Never will I take CS again. She may know the material content but she sucks at trying to pass the message across. She can do absolutely better. Yep!
So far so good. This is the grad level course - Computer Foundations 1. Nice and clear. Happy to help.
The professor is the most "lovely"  professor I ever met. :)

100 homework problems before the final with few accessible office hours. Teaches things in a weird order, doesn't explain important things and goes in-depth with useless things. If you're in an art-related field, she expects you to work like a CS major. She also doesn't care about helping students who are struggling. TA's don't even understand her.
Show up and you'll pass with flying colors.

The lectures are long and hard to stay awake in, but they are informative and clear (bring coffee). Go to class, do the homework, read the book if you need extra help, and you should be well on your way to having a good understanding of the language. It's programming, so of course it will be frustrating. Best advice: DO THE XC! It's worth 8 points!

I came into this class with no knowledge of c++ it was required for my major. I still have no idea what c++ is, test was hard because it was written, lectures were impossible to understand due to her very heavy accent, homeworks were just as hard they took hours to complete. She is a very tough teacher, avoid this class

This class is a very easy. Its the basics of computer science and the labs get a little difficult at the end of the quarter but if you have some type of background then you will be fine! Do all the extra credit on the labs and you will for sure get an A+. Boring class and she is hard to understand but if you have to take this class, take her.

I had several classes with Professor Medlock, formerly Alban, in the early 2000s.  She is very difficult to understand. It is clear she knows her material but she continually fails to communicate it. The actual teaching is done by the TA's. Avoid her at all costs.

I took CS 161, which was the biggest joke ever. No one ever payed attention to her during lectures, which you can barely understand anyway because of her accent.  Labs were extremely easy, it was impossible not to get anything but an A on the lab.

I had no knowledge of C++ before taking this class. It's a rough transition. You have to spend countless hours on the homeworks and go to the CLC. The quizzes are kinda tough and the labs are easy but aren't given enough weight. The final wasn't hard, but I received a D instead of a B on it which was misleading. Beware, programming takes time.

I have never thought about learning c++ before this course. It was required for my major.After the course...I still have absolutely NO knowledge of c++. Her lectures are full of garbled english, and the homeworks are impossible because you can't understand what she was suppossed to be teaching.

I'm actually in her class right now and I'm learning more from surfing the internet for reviews of her and using YouTube tutorials than I am from her.  True story, ask everyone behind me who is so bored they're watching me type this.
Great teacher if you go to her class, but you can use the book and its about the same thing.

She teaches programming exactly the way it shouldn't be taught.  Instead of grading based on program performance, she grades based on whether it was written exactly as whatever book she pulled it from, regardless of what it returns.  Exams are given on paper.  How many programmers out there memorize their libraries?  None?  Thank you.
easy class, but in no way prepares you for programming so it was pointless. easy A.
She's a bit hard to understand and unclear sometimes, but she knows her stuff. If you have some knowledge of C++ you will do fine, just do the Homeworks and Labs, the exams are not that hard!

As an Asian woman, don't really know what everyone else here is talking about. Still got an A despite missing a few assignments and professor was really caring towards me! I think the hate is overblown.

Kurt is a nice guy deep down, but he comes off as very abrasive. The 2-3 weekly assignments are quite heavy, so make sure to listen to his lectures, otherwise you WILL be lost. He also grades everything all at once--at the very end of the term.
if you hate kurt you should probably change majors tbh

Taking Kurt classes is definitely a learning curve. I hated him when I took 260 and 265, however, his 277 lectures are actually pretty good and I was able to understand the content. Definitely daunting at first but if you stick with him you'll learn a lot. Don't be afraid to ask him questions too, he's very understanding and gives good answers

Probably one of the worst professors in CCI. Tasks are extremely unclear and feedback doesn't exist. I got only 3 tasks graded by end of Week 9 (we have 2 tasks every week + 1 every two weeks). Avoid if possible. Course content isn't that difficult, it is possible to study on your own

it is currently week 8 and he has graded 3 assignments out of 10 so far. I have absolutely no idea if I am passing the class or if I shouldve withdrew. On top of that the directions for the assignments are often contradictory or confusing. If you ask him for clarification, he just tells you to read the directions and gets mad at you.
He was not good at teaching and did not care to really teach us

In all honesty, Kurt isn't that bad of a professor. He was a bit disorganized at times, but he did teach the material in an understandable way. By all means, he's not a perfect professor, but he does expect the a lot out of students and wants everyone to understand the material.
bro can't even use email and wants to talk comp sci. In all seriousness, he's okay, but like man, be a little more open to communication.

There is a reputation surrounding Schmidt that is not justified. Yes, he can be gruff and a little harsh but if you put work in and show up, the class is not that bad. If you do not put the effort in, he will know and will have little sympathy when you struggle. His slides are excellent and his lectures are rich in information.

I had Kurt for both CS 265 and 260. I see a lot of reviews on here that grossly overexaggerate what it's like to be in his class. He has high expectations for students because he believes they are capable of handling it and doesn't want to hand-hold. Homework is hard so give yourself time. Inquire/get help when needed and you'll be fine.

I think the class was already hard but Kurt just makes it worse. The assigned textbook was just bad, and while the lectures are fine, it just didn't feel in-depth enough for the homework. Combined with weekly quizzes, your gpa MAY be toast. I personally think he's a cool guy and grades fair but I'm probably going to avoid him if I could.

Avoid at all costs. Most unnecessarily difficult class I have ever taken. The pop quizzes given in class make the actual lectures effectively worthless as he expects you to already know all the material. This is compounded by the fact that the homework is extremely difficult and there is lots of it. Avoid to save your GPA

Unstructured class, petty & unprofessional teacher, & challenging coursework collide in Kurt's CS260. 

He cusses like a sailor, completely fails to give clear, concise explanations of course material, & becomes irate when students come to class without a good understanding of the reading & concepts.

Avoid if at all possible. Kurt's 1 of the WOAT.

I took kurt for 260 and thought that was hard. im in week 2 of this class and it genuinely has me questioning my decision to go to drexel. i have always been passionate about computer science and genuinely have an interest in what this course is teaching but i feel like im not learning anything and the content keeps getting harder.

If you can pass this class, you can get your CS degree. Can be hostile in the classroom but a nice guy in office hours. Class could have used better organization and direction at times. Communication was non-existent at times which was annoying. Overall, ok.
I would rather walk through 7 miles of broken glass than do this again

In the face of an almighty being, I would rather bargain with them than take this horrid class once more. The assignments are poorly worded, you will never get grades back for weeks, and you have to know everything before the lecture starts. My bad, I should have known CS265 before entering to learn about CS265. Avoid it, don't even try at all. GL!
Rambles about random topics all class for 3 hours a week, assigns 10 hours of homework each week, grades crazy hard. - avoid

It is so much easier to learn Chinese in 6 months than taking Kurt Schmidt for 10 weeks since Chinese grammar has a clear outline unlike Kurt's assignments. Also the grading is more sensitive than my cavity filled teeth after biting into a popsicle. The most interesting part of his lecture is the "try not to fall asleep during lectures" challenge.
Hard guy, but teaches you good stuff

I took multiple classes with Kurt over covid. I truly wish him the worst. He canceled all sections, decided to have one recorded lecture at a time that worked for him. 
Most students were unable to attend, and the majority of the lecture was him asking what we didn't know. He also told us almost none of us should get an A on the final.
AVOID HIM.
He is quite fair in exams and assignments.

I had low expectations considering the reputation Schmidt has, but he honestly was not that bad. Maybe my opinion of the workload was offset by the difficulty of other classes I was also taking (CS270...) but I thought his class wasn't too bad. The content is difficult but I felt he explained it pretty well and I gained a lot of useful skills.

Kurt is a strange professor for sure, but I really believe I learned a lot from his lectures and his little rants. I don't think he is a professor for everyone, and he goes on little tangents sometimes, but if you enjoy participating and show up to all lectures you'll learn super valuable concepts for all of cs
If you are an Asian girl and love to sail, you will pass the class!

Kurt will have you wondering if you're truly interested in CS. He assumes you have more experience than you do. He's mostly laid back and funny during lectures, but beware he has a short temper, and every class he'll mumble something that you have no clue about. Assignments are time consuming. Surviving a Kurt-class is a drexel-CS right of passage.

A lot of people think that he's mean, which I also thought at first... but getting to know him, he is actually caring for his students. There are times when he can become a bit intense when teaching, but I would say it's in the sense of "tough love". If you really talk to him about your progress, he is willing to help you. Just communicate.

Schmidt is a nice person but a horrible teacher. 50% of the class is knowing the material. 50% of the class is interpreting what he wants you to do for activities, labs, and assignments. You will interpret incorrectly. You will lose letter grades. He is hyper specific about things and gives poor examples. He will not give credit back. Stay away.
He is a really fun professor. As long as you are not dumb, you will be fine.

I'm glad I had Kurt this term. Do not come into this course expecting an A or GPA boost. You will, however, be pushed and learn the material very well. Kurt is very fun to talk to one-on-one, especially when you go to him during office hours. His lectures were a bit scattered, but fun to listen to. I will be taking him next term.

Kurt Schmidt is a terrible instructor. He may know what he's "teaching" but can't teach it in the slightest form. All assignments are not clear and grading can often be tough. Lectures are boring and do not actually teach the material. Avoid Kurt at all costs.

I got many mixed messages from friends when I asked how Prof Schmidt was. After taking him I understand. I would say he does an ok job at lecturing, and the course difficulty was definitely difficult but not impossible, even for myself who is not a CS major. If you need to take his class, be prepared to work but imho it wont be the hardest class

When I took this class, I did not like it. The material is challenging and Kurt's way of teaching did not make things any better. He does however have a great knowledge of Linux which comes through during the first part of this course. This class is one of the few that taught something practical, and I wouldn't trust anyone else but Kurt for it.

Keeping it short, No experience, more homeworks, no help. Labs are too lengthy and needs to be done on your own. HWs are pathetic and explains you nothing clearly. Better go for some other professor and try getting a class in Summer

I took him Professor Schmidt in Spring 2021 and it was the biggest mistake I made. Poor lectures, no clearity on what he teaches, and labs and assignments are too tough. Although the exam was very tough, but I managed to get a B-, Thanks to P/NP option

This class, at least in its online format, is basically a learn nothing get tested on everything course. It's truly remarkable how little K Schmidt cares about his students and whether or not they actually learn anything in his course. Good luck getting any help from him either. When I did get a chance to ask questions, he acted like I was stupid.

Honestly one of the biggest regrets I have taking this professor. His lectures are literally pointless and a waste of time. The HWs are extremely long and barely correlates to the lectures and he literally takes points off for fun. He is aggressive towards students that ask for help. He doesn't submit grades on time so students are always confused.

This class would be so much more enjoyable and easy to follow if Prof. Schmidt gave clear instructions and a rubric for assignments. He communicates poorly with students, making it extremely hard to understand what he wants from you.

Unless you are a natural at computer science, I'd suggest taking a different professor. It's clear that he has good intentions for his students, but he doesn't know how to teach in a way that suits everyone. He expects everyone to be on his level and won't provide sufficient help if you are falling behind or don't understand the material.

He is naturally of terrible character. I took him for the first time despite multiple warnings and regretted it on day one. Please, for your own sake, DO NOT REGISTER FOR A CLASS WITH KURT. He barely talks about anything related to class, during class! His labs are hard to understand and assignments are harder than finals! Beware!

He is an interesting professor and the class was hard when I took it a couple years ago. But he made me a better programmer and really aligned me to be who I am today in programming. This class is a weed-out class and is taught by a professor who can find the ones who wont make it through the CS degree. CS gets a lot harder after this class

Boring lecturer. Gives out tons of work. Cirriculum he designs is a mess of poorly connected topics. Take some of the edge off and register for literally anybody elses section if possible. He should really be in industry instead of academia.

You are quizzed on the lecture notes before you are taught the material... The quizzes are sometimes unforgiving, requiring precisely typed fill-in-the-blank code. Labs take far longer than the reserved time of 1 hour, so expect weekend homework every week. I'm convinced that lectures are a waste of time because I have to teach myself anyway.

The professor is unable to explain the concepts clearly, And he does not provide help during the lab class. Have question? He'll ask you to read the materials. Can't understand? Then read again. Do not expect him to solve your problems during the lab.

Kurt doesn't know how to teach in the class, he selects one TA and tells him to go over the slides. He gives 3 assignments in his course and doesn't even explain anything about it. You have to do everything on your own. Some of the students believe that he tries to fail students and reports to the college all the time.

He knows everything about bash scripting, but his teaching style is so bad because he just reads stuff from powerpoint, and nobody has any idea what to do when he is teaching. Although, he gives prior quiz which you have to give before the lecture so you have to learn everything by yourself before the class starts.

He doesn't teach anything in his class, he just goes over presentation. Also, when it comes to the assignment he gives the hardest assignment he could make. Also, finals will be so hard it would make no sense. Worst professor I ever have taken.
Just not a good teacher. Full of himself and his fairly outdated approach to CS.

CS 260 is hard. The average for the midterm was a 57%... His response: "If you're above average, you're doing well." He sometimes is rude to students and acts like it's a joke. I'm not a fan of his personality, but at least he is passionate about teaching, and the material is good. Lots of stuff though, and he talks fast. But you learn a lot!
Good professor. Fair on assignments and approachable.

This instructor represents everything wrong with modern CS instructors. Refuses to teach and expects you to magically figure everything out. Pre-lecture quizzes, hard assignments, hard labs, and no help at all. Set up like a kangaroo court, where you will have a trial by fire. He monopolizes the class section so you will have to endure. BE READY!

Well, he knows the material very well and his lab/HW/note did help you to understand the materials better. However, he is very strict on tiny little details that most of the people will neglect such as filename, target name etc. His problem descriptions are not very clear. He isn't very supportive when you ask questions. This is a tough class.
Literally garbage. Refer to koofers for my much longer than 350 character review.

Kurt is fantastic at weeding out programmers that aren't willing to learn. Taking classes with him will be difficult,  as he is a rather blunt individual, but I would wholeheartedly recommend taking as many CS courses under him as you can if you're worth your weight in code. However, if your motto is "Cs get degrees", avoid this prof at all costs.

Highly competent programmer, don't take this class if you can't handle the workload though. He doesn't like simple questions that have already been covered so study the notes he gives you. Obviously if you have trouble in this course programming might not be for you.  He makes a lot of hilarious banter and is an overall good guy.

Best professor I had in an undergrad course, really teaches the material well. If you don't act like an idiot he won't treat you like an idiot...e.g. if you can find the answer to your question on the first page of Google don't waste time asking it. He expects you care about the material/course, if don't then don't expect him to care much for you.

Bitter failed programmer, easily the worst prof I've had at Drexel. Takes massive points off for the most trivial things like not naming your submitted files EXACTLY as specified or submitting work in a zip file. Gives pre-lecture quizzes on things we haven't learned yet. Don't bother asking questions because he'll belittle you.

Homework is not clear and is not graded properly, pre-lecture quizzes should never be a thing in the first place, and he threatens to take off points if you email him with  anything that he considers to be a stupid question.  I'm not sure why he's in charge of such an important course.

Took 2 CS Courses with him. As long as you go into the class with a good attitude and answer questions you'll come out loving that class. Took his class with a bunch of friends and never regretted it, great guy, huge on politics.

Half of this class was dedicated to learning C, the backbone of Labview. Kurt had to teach us non-CS majors the basics of C and he did a pretty good job. He went really quickly and he was a tough grader, but in the end I came out of it with a good grade and I could write a lot of useful code. Avoid him if you can, but work hard if you get him.

This professor is the reason I switched out of the SE program (CS265 is mandatory, he's the only one who teaches it). Our textbook was in C++, but he taught in an odd mix of C# and Python. Incredibly hard to follow, talked about nothing but Big O, useless when asked for help. Little respect for students, often showed up late.

Awesome teacher, really enjoyed his class. I'm not really sure why other reviews say he's a bad instructor, I found him to be extremely helpful and overall a great professor. Then again, I actually like attending class so maybe that's why.

Kurt is a good professor. You need to be able to be motivated to learn and go to class (stop slacking), but hes an interesting dude. He also pays a lot of attention to teaching concepts, keep a look out for them. I learned very much from his classes. The assignments are also great! The best and most fun assignments I've had at Drexel.
He's The worst teacher ever.  I had him for c++.  All this guy talked about was unix.  He didn't teach crap.  Please avoid him.  Don't know why Drexel keeps him
Certified badass.  Guy looks like Steven Seagal.  Good professor too, actually knows his stuff, which is rare for drexel profs.

I feel he does not care for teaching it right. The course is something I could have done of Wikipedia and Google. He does not grade on how much work gpt put in, he runs scripts on your homeworks. His TAs are much more efficient and clear.

Some professors are very prompt with their email responses and feel very reachable. Kurt is not one of them. However he's a decent professor, and I enjoy his classes. He's got a system he sticks to for assignment and lab submissions; it mostly works mitigating the impact homework screw-ups (ie: crappy submission or bad grading)
Avoid him if you can. Doesnt teach the material and puts in the test what he hasnt taught or even mentioned. He has a BIG ego problem
Avoid him if you can. Will find every opportunity to mock you if u ask a question and hardly does anything useful in class, ull ave to teach yourself everything.
One of the worst teachers ever!  If you ask a question he goes off on a rant about how stupid you are for asking.
Does not teach the material at all.

About the worse teacher you could ever get at Drexel. I stopped going to this class midway and ended up getter better grades on the tests. He does not want to teach and does not have any teaching ability whatsoever. If you ask him a question, he tries to make you feel stupid so can he feel better about himself, which is sad. avoid taking his class
big ego problem. Learn mostly everything by yourself. TA don't know how to grade (maybe except for Jesse)
I hate this MFuker! I cant believe I am paying his salary
No Comments
Very hard. Attitude problem when answering questions.
No Comments

I didn't see any reason to go to his lecture after a couple of weeks, it was super confusing while he kept saying it was super easy and also spoke very quietly. You'll have to learn on your own if you want a good grade. The course is pretty interesting though.
However, if you want to really learn and understand I wouldn't recommend taking him.

I want to preface this with saying professor Chang truly wants his students to learn and succeed.  With that being said, sadly I would have to say his lectures are very hard to understand.  My advice would be, put in the effort, ask questions when you are confused and you are likely to succeed with a good grade.

A little bit difficult to understand sometimes because he doesn't talk very loud so I would suggest sitting in the front if you can. Wants all of his students to do well. Homework reflects what will be on exams and quizzes plus all exams and quizzes were open note. Willing to help you out during an exam or quiz if needed!
He is a great person and dedicated teacher. He knows what he is teaching.

Feel bad writing this, he is a really nice guy. Not clear going over things in lecture. Repeatedly says the material is simple when everyone is scratching their head. Graded quizzestests get no feedback. Ask to explain things, says it's simple, just practice. I can't learn when I don't know if i'm doing problems correctly, or why I am wrong.
He is great teacher. He is soft-spoken  as it is so hard to hear him  in class.
Great teacher! Make sure you take his class.

Professor Chang is a very good professor. He teaches the course very obviously by lots of examples. In addition, you can do the homework and take-home exam by his examples. If you have any problem to ask him, he has a lot of patient to teach you again and makr sure you understand the materials. I will choose his course again and again.
No Comments

Probably one of the worst english teachers you'll have. She constantly contradicts herself and forgets what she said 5 minutes ago. She once marked punctuation wrong from a direct quote from the book.
Not sure why she is allowed to be a professor. How am I paying money for this class.

-adjunct: only teaches maximum two ENGL sections per term (none spring 2017) -classical literature accompanying book: old lady likes old things (and not even the popular older books like The Great Gatsby, she picks the books that no one has heard of before) -discussions play a part in the class as she starts every class "Anything new on the news?"

She would tell us one rule then completely change her mind and backtrack and tell us the exact opposite.  She would require that our theses were approved by her but she would give approval and then change her mind and then once you completely change your thesis she'd make you change it back.  Don't take her if you value your sanity.
Worst experience I have ever had in an English class

Professor Franklin is a kind, understanding, and enjoyable professor.  She is older, and as such, sometimes loses track of what is actually going on; her sense of grammar is impeccable for the 1980s, but has not progressed beyond that.  If you participate and show up consistently and write papers with good grammar, you will do very well.

She is constantly contradicting herself. She will ask the students only to speak when they are called on and yell at you when you speak out of place, while other days she will yell at you for not saying the answer aloud. There isn't a heavy work load but it is difficult to get an A from her.

Hard of hearing that you have to repeat what you said like 50 times...She doesn't grade well. Lots of readings. You have to write three essays, and they're the only grades in the class. No tests, etc, but one pop quiz.
Terrible the worst english teacher i have ever had!!!!
She was really strict...I f'n had to spit out my gum like 4 times because of her. Class wasn't that hard...work load wasn't high.
Her grading system was very subjective. If she graded your paper last, you would receive a lower grade... Overall clarity for assignemnts wasn't very clear either... :(

Condescending, patronizing, treats her class like high school students. Highly restricts paper topics, requires a modified format that no single person has managed to make work on their computer and doesn't know how to do it herself. Contradicts herself often and blames students for the confusion this causes.
She was an ok professor... and her quizzes were easy.

When asked to explain a problem, he says to go to the MRC for them to explain. Is a very stingy grader when it comes to partial credit. Is unable to finish grading a quiz before you take a new one, so learning from your mistakes on the previous quiz is not possible. Is not open to meeting outside of his posted office hours.

He is such a bad lecturer, he basically just writes on the chalkboard and talks to himself the whole time. The homework and tests are like every other coordinated math class but he provides basically no study materials for exams.

This guy is very rude and perhaps the worst math teacher i have had in my life. I had to drop his math239 class last year because I had below a 1%. I got surgery and he made it difficult to do work while I was out of class. He posted nothing online and did not follow the syllabus so I could not keep up. Now I have an A with Steuber in math239.

Professor Ziemke was a great teacher. Because of his conversational approach to lecturing, I found the more casual tone he created in the classroom to be really great. He would always give us our graded quizzes (and exams) with feedback by the next class, and he made himself available and approachable for questions.
Literally nothing on blackboard, grades take forever. No clear feedback, awful at lecturing. Lectures are just random ramblings. Worst math professor so far

One of my all-time favorite math professors. Your grade will be heavily dependent on your quiz & test scores, but Matt always clearly explains the content and goes out of his way to practice test material before you see it. Calc III can be hard, but he always does a great job of breaking each topic down, and its always available for questions.
Man needs to eat a slice of humble pie. Condescending when you ask questions, be prepared to self-study.

The content of the class goes by fast, but Professor Ziemke always stops to take questions. If you miss class it will be hard to get notes unless you have a friend in the class because he doesn't post the notes on Blackboard, so make a friend in the class. Graded by just the webwork and the 2 midterms and final.

He's a good professor. Maybe not the most riveting lectures, but I think that kind of comes with the material in real analysis. Mostly, his structuring of the class and the grade layout is amazing. If you're a math major scared of real analysis, don't be. He goes slow, the tests are more than fair, the homework is satisfying. He does it well.

Great teacher to have for math 123. He goes over lots of practice problems so that you are prepared and he does not assign any hw, just weekly quizzes that are mostly based on the practice problems and examples done in class but with slight variation. Very likeable teacher and is very open to questions.
Ziemke is great. I took him for MATH123 as a Computer Science major, and he's inspired me to minor in mathematics.
n/a

He was great for 116, quizzes are pretty short and easy. In most class all that is done is solving problems, so you would need to study just a bit outside of class or else, you will not understand much. If you do not understand, you could always ask him for help too, he wants his students to succeed. Would definitely take him again.
He's very generous with grading. He also doesn't believe in simplifing which is nice. Honestly the questions on tests and quizzes don't even need a calculator. Very nice and highly recommend

Literally one of the best profs ever. I haven't done this well in a math class in years. He explains everything clearly and the quizzes/tests are exactly what we learn in class. Keep in mind, there is no homework, but he posts examples with answers to practice and ask him about if you need help. I love this class. 100000/10 would recommend!!!

Ziemkeis is TERRIBLE at teaching discrete. His class is very easy and you will pass with a good grade but you will learn NOTHING. If you try to ask him a question he either gets really confused or straight up refuses to answer. He once answered my question by saying "I thought about it" (it wasnt something very easy). Useless for this class

Prof Ziemke was a great teacher.  All of his teachings were intuitive and made sense. He always stopped to answer questions if they were raised. His class is very lecture based as he does not involve the student much in his teachings, but he does an excellent job explaining the material. I'd recommend him if you don't have trouble paying attention.

I thought Ziemke was overall the best a math teacher could get. His lectures are very clear and easy to follow. He's also relatively forgiving when it comes to grading. Would absolutely take one of his classes again.

Goat status - this is for math210 btw but it's not an option. I enjoyed his class because he prepared you well for each exam and told you exactly what you needed to know to succeed. I would definitely take him again.

Every week, quiz on week's topic On weeks without a quiz, midterm test He will drop the lowest quiz grade as a buffer Just don't be late for his class because he starts on the dot. Solid Choice overall

THE BEST PROF EVER. I had the amazing opportunity to be taught by Matt. He is so nice! his lectures are very clear and easy to follow. He also takes his time to explain and answer any questions. Genuinely cares for his students . HIs exams are very straightforward. As long as you follow his lectures you will do well.

Professor Zeimke grades his quizzes really fairly. Ive gotten entire problems wrong and he still gave me credit for my logic. I felt like he taught really well and I went to his office hours a few times and he was really nice. Definitely recommend him.

Matt is a pretty good professor. He goes over things well and he'll go over problems in class. His grading is pretty clear and he gives credit for work rather than correctness. It's a pretty solid pick.

He is a wonderful professor for Calc 1. Gives explicit instructions and explanations on lectures. He goes through each mid-term and quiz problem to make sure his students understand mistakes. He is very helpful during his office hours at MRC and will help you with your homework as well as concepts you will find difficult to understand.

A solid choice for a math professor. Not the best I've had, but he is clear enough during the lectures. He is also accessible during office hours and helpful during those. Office hours are actually the best - you can spend hours with him and he is ready to explain material as thoroughly as you need.
Good techer overall

I took calc 1 in high school but I decided to repeat it for the easy A. I showed up to probably 2/3 of the classes because it was remote synchronous for me. Homework is optional, but I recommend it because the quiz questions (every Friday) are nearly the same. He mostly just does examples in class and answers homework questions

Matt is a great professor! He teaches from the textbook or other provided materials. Do the homework and take notes during lecture. His tests are fair and he is generous with partial credit. He is usually available to help with any questions you have outside of class and after lecture.

I did not like him as a math teacher, he doesn't do a good job of explicitly telling you how to do complete problems, he's very vague. And if you do not do all of the homework you will fail, he picks the questions from quizzes that don't reflect the majority of your homework but only the least practiced problems. He also moves way to fast in class.

The course was a review of calc and a very basic introduction to stats. His quizzes were extremely simple- it is definitely possible to score a 100 on every quiz (plus they are weighted at the end). As long as you go to class, youll be fine. The exams arent made by him, but they were fine. Great, nice, easy prof, just study the probs from class
I love him - he's an absolute gem. Really easy to talk to about grading, and his quizzes are pretty similar to the problems we went over in class. Explains everything pretty well.
Lecture is not mandatory and sort of a waste of time if you can just read the book. Show up for Friday quizzes (he drops the lowest one) and tests and you're set. No homework.

Grades easy but class is just basically 50 minutes of him doing problems on the board by himself. doesnt really explain anything, you p much just have to teach yourself from the book, do homework problems, and go to class if you want to see more examples.
Calc 3. Loved It. Nailed It. Period!

I hope to have him for future classes. As long as you do the homework you will do well on the quizzes and tests. He always tells you when the quizzes and tests will be and the chapters they will cover. He is very willing to give extra help outside the classroom of needed. Extremely nice guy.

Matt has been one of my favorite math professors here at Drexel. He teaches directly from the book, so you always have the reference material on hand. He provided our class with free online copies of the book, which was pretty dope. The quizzes are really easy, with questions taken directly from the homework. Do the homework and you'll do fine.

Matt is the best! Excellent for multivariate calculus. Weekly quizzes are a breeze as long as you do the homework sets and follow the in class examples. Though the class was coordinated and he didn't make the exam, Dr. Z did his best to help us do well on the exams, setting aside 4 class periods to review for each exam.
Joyce's lectures were funny asf and he explained the concepts well 10/10.

he is cool. he does teach a little tangent, but when the class was over, i missed him. he has in person tests and they are short and long answer types. I got an A+ , it was easy. Just attend his class and take down notes. Also, he has extra credit questions in all tests so it is easier to get a 4.0

I took Prof. Joyce's 4-hour lecture. Would never recommend it to anyone, ever. 90% of your grade is based on 3 tests. The homework is pretty difficult for a starter-level course. His tests are ridiculously hard, he gives practice exams that don't prep you for the exams, and his lectures are mind-numbing. Interesting person, but a horrible teacher.

Professor Joyce is a great guy, and he's an amazing lecturer. He makes difficult concepts easy to understand if you pay attention to him. The class is weighted 90% exams, so you need to study. The homework is fairly difficult and takes a long time, but it's not really correlated with exams. If you pay attention in class, study the slides, ur good.
One of my favorite and best professors that I will remember! His jokes in class are a separate reason for you to take him!

Tells fun stories in class, but has no clue about how real students learn or process information. The homework is much harder than what is taught in class and he admits that himself. He also thinks that a C average for the entire class is a good thing and does not put any effort into trying to raise test scores. Fun guy, but not a great professor.

Had this class, with 4 hour long lectures till 11pm. Yet Professor Joyce was able to make what would be a very tiring class, actually very enjoyable and full of learning. You will need to be an engaged student, but if you truly want to be there, then Professor Joyce will go out of his way, to make your time enjoyable and engaging.

If you are lazy, he is not the professor for you. However, if you pay attention to his lectures and put in the effort to study for his exams, they are not too bad. Overall, he is a chill professor and fairly understanding.

Actually the worst. Literally 90% of your grade is based off of 3 tests. He's actually the laziest professor I have ever had in my life. He has no idea what is on the homework he's assigning you and it has nothing to do with what we're learning in class. If you're not good at taking tests you WILL not pass this class.

Homeworks took long time and were basically not related to exams. Grade is based on 2 midterms and one 40% final. He gives practice exams that are similar to exams but his lectures are quite boring. However, he secretly curves your grade up at end of term. There are other professors who teach this class who are much easier so wouldn't recommend.

He really knows his stuff and explains it well. Large 4-hour lecture classes are inherently terrible, but he understands that and makes the best of it. He connects everything to real-world examples, which is very helpful until he goes on a tangent for a single concept. As long as you don't get bored easily you will like the class and pass.

Get ready to teach yourself the whole class. His lectures are boring and he gets off topics really quick. He reads off of the slides and doesn't use other background knowledge to further explain topics. Provides pre-tests that are helpful in studying and give you a good preview of what is going to be on the test.

Mr. Joyce is a great person, however he isn't that great of a teacher. Just reads off of PowerPoints and occasionally provides an interesting real-world example. 2 hour class that got boring quick, many people even left halfway through. Grading is exam-heavy, with the final being 40%. Great person, bad teacher.

Good at explaining certain concepts. Joyce is a bit of a jerk, but it can be entertaining at times. Take the exams very seriously, since they are worth 90% of your grade. He seems super hard, but will secretly curve your grade up. He gets a bad rep, but he is a solid professor as long as you don't fall asleep during lecture.

Homework's often take a long time and don't have much to do with the exams. Lectures are boring and can be hard to pay attention to for almost 2 hours. Not much engagement during class. Often goes off topic about life stories that sort of relate to what we are learning.

Everyone gives Joyce a bad rap but tbh if you work hard, do hw, & read the book, youll do well. Also if youre having trouble with anything he is more than willing to help. It was definitely a class that you had to work hard for your grade in, but youll learn a lot. I also took advantage of the econ tutoring center which helped.

Gets off track really easy and just starts making the most random things imaginable connect to econ. without any explanation. Showed up to almost every class late, didn't respond to emails at all, also really really really boring.

Stephen Joyce is awful. He spent most of his lectures complaining about his wife and family, talking about how he needed to start drinking more, and about how much he disliked his former students. He does not care about his students and will not accommodate for students unless forced to by other faculty or advisors.

About what you expect from these big lecture classes. He's good, he definitely would have been better if I had paid attention at all. But fortunately, I didn't have to pay attention at all and I still got a good grade. Just average, but not in a bad way
Great guy, funny and easy to follow along. Tends to go on rants. Be prepared for a lot of straight-from-the-book work.
The key to this class is to listen to him lecture and worry about taking notes on powerpoints outside of class. He is a really smart guy and I enjoyed his class very much

Professor Joyce is a really funny guy. Most of his classes had a few funny jokes, but the material is heavy. You need to go over your notes to do well. Writing-intensive. You also write everything down because he does not allow you to use a laptop. If you stay on top of your work you will do well but you have to be persistent.
Bad jokes and rudely calls out students. Also doesn't let anyone use electronics (laptop, phone) so you need to hand write all the notes but he goes through slides so quickly it's hard to keep up.
Great and interesting classes. Fair tests.

Honestly, he is an outstanding person. He gave great examples of Economics that allowed you to understand the subject more. However, he would go on about his life stories that were entirely off topic from what we were learning ,great guy as a whole. But, as an actual teacher. Not so much. Only two midterms and one final. The homework is challenging

Joyce is great. Hes genuine and loves the subject he teaches. He tells funny stories throughout the class which is helpful when your in a 3-hour lecture. Do not disrespect him - he sees right through excuses. NO LAPTOPS AND NO CELL PHONES! No joke, trust me on that.

Joyce is a funny guy and a good man. But his class is ridiculous. I had his class for 2 straight hours with Joyce lecturing the entire time and there is no interaction. His voice is very monotone so it's very easy to lose focus during his lecture. The homework is absolutely ridiculous as it has nothing to do with what he talks about in class.

He's a nice guy, sometimes he calls out kids in class, but eh. Very very lecture heavy. Econ is already boring, in my opinion, and he tries to lighten the mood by throwing in jokes or showing videos. He definitely helps his students with practice midterms and in class discussions.
Not a very good teacher and is fairly boring, but can be funny at times and usually gives you what you need to pass the test. Not the worst teacher I've ever had, but does not do much very well.
Absolutely horrible experience with this professor reads off of powerpoint, speaks in a very low tone, homework does not help with understanding the material, very lecture heavy and no interactions.
Extremely boring class. Does not let you use laptops. Gets his test from the PowerPoint and the lectures. A is given at a 90 and up. If you can get through the lectures you'll do fine.

Joyce has a pretty interesting sense of humor that definitely makes class a little more exciting than a normal econ class.  The grading set up is pretty simple, but definitely do your best on all exams because you may be excused from the final if you average a good enough grade! And go to class, he takes attendance.

Pretty decent professor. His lectures and tests all come right off the powerpoints, so all you need to do is study those to pass. If you ask him for help, he won't let you leave until he knows you know it. Despite the class being a 2hr lecture, he kept it bright and entertaining, even gave us a 10min break in the middle. Good prof, highly recommend
Easy class. All he did was read off the power points. You'll have to read the textbook to understand everything or look for help online. The homework was annoying, but helped.

One of the worst teachers I've ever had. Reads the PowerPoint the entire class and makes inappropriate jokes. Absolutely awful. I love Econ and am nothing short of disappointed that he ruined this class.

Makes inappropriate jokes throughout class in an attempt to be funny and engaging. Did not show up for scheduled tutoring session. Reads publicly available PowerPoints during lecture, does not add anything useful to PowerPoint.  Frequently answers phone in class.

He does make a lot of bad jokes, however, he keeps the class engaging, and if you actually pay attention, some of his stories actually do relate to what is being taught. I came into the class with no prior knowledge of Econ and finished with a 98.
He's completely useless and uses corny jokes throughout all of his lectures.

I taught myself all the material by reading the textbook. I would have skipped his worthless lectures -- all he did was read aloud from PowerPoint slides -- but attendance was mandatory. I quickly grew to resent having to show up for class every week and listen to him do his bad stand-up comedy routines. One of many bad experiences at Drexel.

professor gets overly typecast as a 'funny guy'.  while entertaining, his ability to engage every person in the room for 3 straight hours is completely unrivaled.  there is no need to make intro econ tougher than it needs to be.  readings/lectures/notes repeat the same material so it's drilled into your head.  he offers lots of personal insight too

Multiple choice test format and ample practice test questions made this class easier than I thought it would be.  Aplia.com (used for homework and text)was a bit of a pain to use, but not really that challenging.  Don't expect a quick reply if you contact this professor - many of my emails went unanswered.  Class often ended late.
This guy is awesome!!!  He's hilarious and keeps you pretty interested.  I had a terrible time with a crappy teacher in 201 so it was such a relief to get him.  I would recommend him to anyone.

Joyces is the funniest professor at Drexel!! He's a good guy, he will not fail you, gives chances for a A. Econ is tough, but i learned a lot from his class! IF you have and A or a B throughout the whole course, you don't even have to take the final! Great professor!! I'm going to miss him and his stupid jokes!
I hated economics but he constantly cracks jokes so it was fun!
Could be fun and interesting, even funny, but also had a strange mean streak. Overall, he was about an average teacher. This class was an easy B.
No Comments

VERY funny! he makes fun of everyone, and it's great! he really makes you learn the stuff. it isn't the easiest, but he makes it hard for you not to get an A. if you fail everything up to the final you can still get an A in teh class.
No Comments
He is hilarious, keeps class fun and straight forward.  Brings the material to life by using specific examples.
Lectures straight from the text, so you don't need to go to class.  However, he takes attendance and counts it towards your grade.  He contributed nothing to my knowledge of the material.
Maybe one of the WORST profs I had at Drexel.  Can't teach.  Puts stuff on his exams that he never teaches in class. DO NOT TAKE HIM!
Really fun professor. If you can take him, do it! He's great.
Not the ripest tomato on the vine! Disorganized. Seems obsessed with his own weight. Seems to be hiding from the ral world via this profession.
Thinks he's still a student sometimes
Sadistic little man. Insulting levels of apathy toward students, irrational grading criteria that are held up with draconian strictness.

This class is hard. You need to do a lot of practice problems to understand the material. The lectures are n out very clear and the tas during recitation are not very helpful. You have quizzes a midterm a massive project and a final. He ended up curving. Would have been helpful to know before a few kids dropped the major.

Easily worst professor I've had so far, this man cannot teach even if his life depended on it. No idea how he was made a professor. Midterm & final were both impossible. Miller will curve class by half a letter grade, but if given the chance avoid this man at all costs, your mental state and GPA will thank you for it.

I'd give you a zero but I cant do that so I give you a one. Extremely condescending towards students and extremely unhelpful when asked questions in class. Refuses to reexplain anything when asked and his response is usually that he doesn't understand what the student is not understanding. Easily the worst professor I have ever had.

Nasty professor! He is so cranky he doesn't even teach the material. He expects everyone to learn themselves and then after failing half the class he says you should've worked harder. Worst class with this professor. Try and get out of taking it as he will try and eff you up since he believes that students won't get a job if he explains properly

Try and get over with this class it is not worth your time. Professor tricks you by giving easy quizzes then drops a fat bomb on the exam. Wants to see students suffer and make them miserable. Will NOT teach you what you need to know. Worst teacher I have ever had. Wish I could have had some other professor. TA will not help either and is  rude.

Horrible professor. Exams are so insanely hard more than 60% of the class failed the first exam. Unwilling to teach the material and will make you feel stupid. You will have to learn it yourself. TA told me to withdraw. Unfair grading scheme, badly written, unreadable recitation solutions. This class will make you depressed and tank GPA.

Miller was all around just a condescending professor who talked down on his students and provided very minimal help to those who were struggling. Easily the worst professor I have ever had in my almost 4 years at Drexel. Unfortunately, you can't really avoid taking him so just take the GPA hit and move on with your studies.

Miller is the epitome of subpar-ness. His lectures suck, he goes on tangents, he isn't clear, and the exams are painstakingly hard. TAs explain the material way better than him. The average of the midterms is usually an F. May curve the class by a letter grade, but definitely avoid if you can.
The instructor is really bad at communicating information and often rambles during lectures. The tests are wildly inconsistent in difficulty and go from easy to mind-numbingly hard.

I don't dislike Miller personally (not saying that I love the guy either), but he just sounded depressed and disengaged during lectures. Since classes are online with COVID, I think that made things worse for him, but it wasn't a fun time overall. At least the textbook and one of the two TA's were helpful.

David Miller's repulsive attitude makes it hard to attend lectures. He seems to have contempt for his students, and expects them to understand complex subjects without asking questions. If you are confused about the subject material he is condescending and unhelpful. Avoid him if at all possible.

Worst professor I have ever experienced. Blames the students for near failing averages on every test. Regularly insults the intelligence of the students that do not preform well in the class. Refuses to provide solutions for practice exams. Grades ruthlessly and could care less if his class have a failing average term after term. TERRIBLE!

In Thermodynamics your grade is based off 3 test, attending recitation, and the final. The first two test are F averages and the third is about a C. In the end he bumps everyone's grade by at least a whole letter or 2 . GO TO THE STUDENT TEACHERS FOR HELP AND NOT MILLER!
This mans has no idea how to teach. Usually makes incredibly rude and unprofessional comments in class. Sets a bad example for what engineering is like and is very discouraging.

Coming into the class, I had high expectations of myself, and the course itself. My classmates and I were quickly thrown into a downward spiral of depression and angst. If you are forced to take this class, my only advice would be to schedule it at a time in which your gpa can afford to take the hit, because it will.
Doesn't know how to teach.  Never works problems in class.  TAs can't speak English and are unhelpful.

Worst professor you could possibly imagine. Horrendous at teaching, extremely rude, zero interpersonal skills and shows even less excitement for the class than the miserable students. He teaches a class with an F average, what else needs to be said

Miller is not just a poor teacher, he is a poor human being. His classroom is the most hostile learning environment I've yet to experience. He is malicious and vindictive and makes a point of humiliating students who speak up. Grades unfairly. Claims he will not curve, but is forced to by university policy because the class has failing averages.
Got a bad teacher, didn't learn anything from the class, the avg of 2 exam were F

Test averages are around the pass fail mark. TA's can't speak English. Believes he doesn't need to provide answers to practice problems because you can check them yourself. Curves the class but this doesn't help when we can't learn the material.
Incredible lectures and very well-structured assignments. Even though the class was difficult, everyone learned a lot. He did catch me plagiarizing, so be careful! :)

Yusef is the goat of CS. Amazing professor who will help you understand and walk you through the foundations of algorithms. You can tell he wants the best for every student and explains concepts to make them easily understandable. If you can, take him you won't regret it.

Surviving Yusef's CS260 is a CS rite of passage. Lectures are great. He uses real-world tangible examples instead of just math and code. It's a tough class to juggle with the rest of your courses because it has time consuming homework. Tons of extra credit options.

Difficult class for sure, but I can confidently say I learned a lot from Yusuf. Amazing professor who cares about his students' learning experience and clearly has a passion for what he is teaching. Just be ready to put in the work for assignments, which help you learn a ton. Gives many extra credit opportunities as well, would gladly take again!

One of the Best but equally hardest professor. If you genuinely want to be good in CS, I recommend you take this class from Yusuf. Also take other free elective/easy class so that you can give you maximum time in this class.

Go to his office hours if you are confused and ask as many questions as you need. Easily the best CS professor , cares about his students and the material alot. CS260 is the most important CS class aswell you will need to pay attention and if you really want an internship that has DSA questions do leetcode on the side as well.

Yusuf is my favorite CS professor so far. He constantly tries his hardest to make lectures enjoyable and keep everyone interested. He was always super available during office hours to help with the assignments, and the TAs were helpful as well. Would absolutely take a course with him again.

This class will require a lot of work. You may struggle with the homework if you aren't proficient in C, but it becomes manageable as you get used to it. Yusuf is a good professor and he offers plenty of extra credit throughout the class. I would recommend taking this class seriously if you want to really learn the material and receive a good grade
Really has a passion for what he is teaching and cares about the students. The content of the course is very hard, but he isn't too strict about grading. One of my favorite professors I have had.

What a great guy. The class itself is very difficult and you need to put in a lot of effort, but the professor is very caring and isn't punishing. He gives plenty of extra credit, grades assignments not too harshly, and has a very light total grade scale. If you put in the effort, you will pass, and if you put in more you will get a good grade.

Yusuf is an amazing addition to the department of Computer Science. He genuinely cares about his students, grades forgivingly, gives tons of extra credit in exams and assingments and will help you the best he can if you are interested in learning the content. He is not the best lecturer I have seen but his passion still shines through.

Get ready to WORK in this class - probably the most demanding professor I had. He gives 5 programming and 2 written assignments, each taking a lot of hours an patience. If you are not good with C, avoid his class. The midterm is unreasonably long and hard. He gives questions you cannot study for, which really makes you learn the material well.

Professor Yusuf Osmanlioglu is my favorite professor in the CS department, there is a quiz every class graded mostly based on effort. He entertains the class with interview questions that are very helpful. The only downside would be the written assignments they were a little hard and long, but they help you understand the material clearly.

Yusuf obviously has a passion for computer science and wants students to learn AND succeed. This was his first time teaching the class and I definitely learned a lot. However, I'd be lying if I said I didn't have to reiterate his lectures with a youtube lesson. He explains subjects with words when simple drawings would be a huge help in this class

The workload has been hard to manage. The heavy use of C has also not helped. Hopefully, Yusuf will improve the workload for future courses he teaches. Yusuf wants us to succeed, which is evident through all the extra time he puts in. Not an easy course, but if you are willing to put in a LOT of extra work, you will learn a great deal.

If you are truly interested in Information Systems, he's a great professor. You can tell he's passionate about what he's teaching. His lectures are lengthy, and are borderline boring to me. He loves A.I, so that's a major relief.

I am just saying this. I do not care who you are or what your major is, if you do not like Ram, there has to be something wrong with you. He really cares about his students and goes above and beyond to make them succeed. If Drexel had more professors like Ram I think it would be a much better college.

Yall this man is so nice omg! A 100/10 professor, so understanding, and always responded back to emails. I wish I went to his class more often he's a great lecturer, makes things interesting to learn. One of the best truly very sweet and caring, if he's teaching the section definitely take him. Very lax on due dates too.

One of the best Prof in CCI. I cant explain how empathatic Dr. Ram is, he is knowledgable and knows what he is doing. He teaches good material. Not just bookish knowledhe but market value and what/how you can land a good place. Dr. Ram is always available on emails, and replies proactively. There is project for this course can be done 4-6 people.
Online class, literally saw the guy twice the entire term
Great lectures, and provides great feedback. A very straightforward class. Most of the class is working on online assignments and discussion boards.
Rios is a great professor
Professor Rios is one my the best teachers I have had in such a long time. During my year Drexel he was one of the only professors I looked forward to attending class for.
Such a great professor - his lectures are super engaging and interesting. The class is very easy if you show up and listen. Would definitely take his class again!

If you want to learn business in a fun environment, this is the class you need to take. Needless to say, he cares about his students and the class is extremely discussion based which makes it even more interesting.
One of the best professors at Drexel University. Rios is there to help you out if you seek guidance! Amazing class and relevant group assignments.
Had Rios for the last two terms, really funny guy and his class is easy. He is also super understanding during those group projects. if you communicate, he's gonna be your best friend
Straightforward, funny professor. Weekly quizzes and HWs (takes less than 30 minutes). Take him, you won't regret it.
Eric was by far my best professor, he's a great guy and is always willing to help. He takes attendance on Wednesday during the class activities. Easy grader, as long as you do your work, you're fine

Eric was my favorite professor in the last two terms. He's class is easy as long as you do your work and come to class. He's lectures were very enjoyable and interesting. He's an overall amazing person, will help you out and will give you feedback. If you got him as your professor, you got lucky! Learned a lot in his classes!
Great guy, really good personality. Funny too! He has so many stories! I enjoyed going to his classes. Down to earth guy who cares about his students! I would take again A+++

Had Rios again for Busn102. Have nothing but good things to say. Extremely friendly, caring, and understanding professor. Easy class and he makes it as engaging as possible, despite being virtual. Some assignments are busywork, however, his personality and candor make it worth it and enjoyable. Literally have not heard a single bad thing abt him.

Rios is a legend. He's seriously so chill and understanding, trust me, you want to take this guy's class. He will respond to emails really quickly if you ever need help. Group project heavy but not difficult at all. Cameras required to be on most of the time and he'll call on people randomly to participate.

Great guy, easy class-literally just busywork tbh. Great professor, cares for his students, and willing to help out. You don't even need to read the textbook, quizzes are super easy and if you pay attention to lectures you'll get an A. Lectures can get boring because they're basically downloaded from Pearson but they're easy and light/easy homework

Taken virtually during the pandemic. Professor Rios has hilarious and interesting lectures with great real-life stories. He will almost force everyone to get involved, so you need to pay attention. He is extremely easy to reach and quick to answer emails. Rios certainly cares about the success of students both in and outside of the class.

Had Eric online. He knows what hes doing with technology and is very chill, always on top of things. Funny, kind, understanding, keeps on topic. Randomly calls on people to ask questions like an hour into the lecture so its important to pay attention. He's not always best at explaining the bigger assignments. TA's were great.

He is a great professor. I feel like I have learned something, and his lectures are really not bad to sit through. I was nervous about him at first because attendance was mediatory, and he seemed like a tough grader, but he exceeded my expectations. TAKE HIS CLASS TRUST ME! (the class is not that difficult).

Professor Rios was great! The class was online due to the pandemic, but he was very accomodating and truly cares about his students. He always made sure we knew when things were due and the expectations he had. Responds quickly to emails and was accessible outside of class. Great foundation for business!

Professor Rios's class is super easy and fun to be in. He teaches by putting you into real life scenarios and makes everything easy to understand. I would take him again without a doubt. Do the work on time and everything will be a walk in the park. He also has awesome cop stories. Definitely recommend!!

Rios is great, humorous and helpful. His class is an easy A, and answering his questions in class might get you extra credit. The best professor I have had yet. I had him for 101 and 102 and he was great in both. He gives real world examples that help you understand better, and almost always tells you exactly what to study for the exam.
Rios is a great prof, hilarious and seems to genuinely care about his students.
Rios is a kind and humorous prof.
He is a smart and funny professor
One of the best teachers I have ever had. very clear on what he wants and pretty easy grader.
He is a phenomenal guy and professor

Overall, it was a well run course. Throughout the term, I felt comfortable communicating with the professor and the class TA about small issues I was having. The textbook wasn't really needed for the class. The PowerPoints were sufficient enough to do well on the tests. The group projects were interesting.

AWESOME TEACHER. IF YOU ARE READING THIS RIOS, I JUST WANTED TO LET YOU KNOW YOU ARE THE BEST!!!   P.S. if you failed this class, please comment and give me your phone number. I rlly want to meet and get an autograph of such person

He's great! He tells you everything that's going to be on the test the class before both the midterm and the final. The projects are kind of dull and annoying, but easy. No one fails this class unless they try to...
Great prof. Good person, knows is stuff and very funny. Will take other courses he teaches. He's also a hottie!!
wonderful teacher! Very funny! Great guy! wish he tought more classes!
If you fail, you tried to. EASY CLASS!!
Great, funny, & helpful! Will take his class as much as I can!
amazing professor, seeing everyone's group projects was really fun at the end of the term. this was the only class that i was sad that it came to an end

50% of this class is working on coding assignments, labs, and readings, the other 50% is working on a group project. All the labs are done in class, and relates to the coding assignment you have to do. Readings are ez pz and labs aren't counted for completion. Honestly a very relax and fun class to take, especially with Professor Long!

I'm writing this almost a year after taking 265 with professor Long and they genuinely did such a good job of teaching C. This was probably the most informative class that I have taken in all of my time at Drexel. Long is very good at answering questions so be sure to ask. Easily one of the best professors at Drexel.
Great Professor! You'd not regret it!!!

Professor Long is a really amazing Professor, they were able to make web dev understandable for even complete novices such as myself. The material is quite frontloaded in the first few weeks, but the sequence of material is logical and will make you understand the intricacies of web dev much better.

One of the best professors I've had. They explain things very clearly and are organized. First 5 weeks are just assignments. They're not some long verbose chapter or textbook but 2-3 small readings that teach you about JavaScript, Postgres, APIs, and Express. 
Midterm is just a programming assignment. No final exam just a group project.

Pfr. Long made this class unnecessarily difficult for her students by assigning up to three long and difficult assignments per week that were graded using automated tests that often crashed our code even though it worked on our computer, leading to much lower grades than we deserved. Also, the final grade was way too dependent on assignments.

Amazing Professor. Professor Long actually cares about their students. They are always willing to help. Each class is set up with a short lecture, then working on assignments and labs, where Professor Long is there to answer any and all questions.

This is one of those classes you HAVE TO ask questions or you won't get far.
Literally my new favorite CS professor. They indulge each students' questions to make sure we understand. Absolutely amazing.
I love Galen Long, if you have the chance take their class! Super nice, and explains concepts very well
CS375 is a really easy class, basic javascript for a few weeks and one group project for the rest. Galen is easy going, offers practical help and does timely grading. Would def take again.
Probably the best professor at Drexel.

Prof. Long have a really clear and succinct style of teaching. They made the class as interesting as possible while keeping the whole thing accessible and grounded at the same time. Do the readings, take time on the homework sets and you will be fine.
Good professor. Really cares about their students. They aren't an amazing lecturer but they will work with you until you understand the concept.

The single best professor I've had at Drexel. Long is very knowledgeable and kind. They'll answer your questions politely, and encourage them too. The environment that they create inside the class encourages you to ask more questions and clear any confusion. I've taken three courses with them (CS 260, CS 277, CS 375). Highly recommended.
Galen Long is probably one of the best CS faculty members that I have personally come across. They answer questions well, are clear with their lectures and care about their students.
