Unfortunately Prof. Gregory's lectures make it hard for students to truly grasp what you actually need to study to do well in his class. He does not tell what paintings you need to know for the exam until just a few days before. Despite his exams being multiple-choice, the answers seem subjective. And his lectures are boring and monotonous.

This professor made ART102 unbearable. The lectures are long and not at all engaging. There is so much information being thrown at you, whether it's the slides FILLED with words or his monotone lecturing. Since there is so much information, there is no way for us to know what will be important to study for tests (it isn't specified).

I don't think he wants to be an art history professor. His lectures so far are ONLY about religious history/ philosophy. Obviously thats an important topic to cover for art of this time period, but he goes on WAY too long and monotone rants about the religious context of every photo & nothing else about the piece of work. & Big Jordan Peterson vibe

Dr. Gregory is awesome. This class has been my favorite so far at Drexel. His lectures are really interesting, he cares about how his students are doing, and is generous with his time. There are only 4 tests and a final paper, and he lets you choose what art work/artist you want to write about. I suggest going to his online test review sessions!

Awful experience, he made this class so much harder for no reason. After taking 101 with Pia, who was amazing, I expected this class to run similarly. It did not. He does not specify the importance of what he is saying during the lecture. You must go to review the video session to learn what was not in class on tests, which is not fair.

Dr. Gregory rocks. He is brilliant, cares about his students, and is good at helping you see the micro-macro ideas of subjects. I recommend chatting with him outside of class, he always has a lot of interesting ideas to share!

Joseph Gregory works hard to make lectures effective for students learning. If you want to pass, you need to pay attention. He does not allow online notes without an accommodation, but you should still take paper notes. His tests are drop-dead easy, like straight 95+ grades if you go to lectures and the review sessions.

Joseph Gregory's class is great. Lectures can be boring at times and often he teaches more than is necessary for the quizzes, but he does not give homework and the quizzes are pretty easy as long as you have a basic understanding of the content

The class is lecture-heavy so if you do well with lectures, take it. Personally, I think he makes the lectures very interesting (storytelling). 3 exams 1 paper throughout the term. They are pretty straightforward as long as you listened in class (writing notes is helpful). Lectures are recorded so it's okay even if you got sick and missed a class.

Very good teacher but I did not like the structure of this class. The way the answers to the test questions are worded make the test tricky and hard to study for. There are only 3 tests that count towards the grade, plus the final paper so it makes it very nerve wracking to fail one test.

He knows a LOT about art, but his lectures are hard to understand. It's hard to tell what is a key point about the artwork that we should remember and what is just a fun fact he decided to tell us, and you can't write down everything he says because he says so much. I did great in Arth101 with a different professor and poor in this class

Dr. Gregory is very knowledgeable about art history and you will learn in his class. However, I found his lectures to be boring and redundant, and the technology ban doesn't help. Attendance taken every class. Grade based on midterm, final, and final paper and he doesn't use BB so you will only get to know the midterm grade and then Banner grade.

Dr. Gregory is an amazing professor for students who are not very interested in Art History initially. The first couple classes are very philosophical which could be boring, but the actual content itself is very interesting. It is like storytelling for each artwork. He gives out HUGE curves for midterm (B to A+). Must take handwritten notes!!!
He is very knowledgable in art history. However, his lectures dragged on forever and we can't use laptops in class! Final grade only consists of a quiz, two exams, and an essay.

Dr. Gregory is the best professor Ive ever had to date. I had him for 102 and just felt like I needed to take him for 103. He is profound, and clearly knowledgeable about the topics covered this course. His lectures provoked a lot of thought in me throughout the class, and i found myself constantly engaged and interested in what he was saying.

I had Dr. Gregory for ARTH 102 & 103, and he knows what he's talking about. Dr. Gregory really has such a vast knowledge of art history. You really have to pay attention because his slides don't have words, just the artwork, name, artist and year. He'll go on tangents about unimportant things sometimes, but I learned so much from his classes.

Dr. Gregory is incredibly pretentious, and I almost dropped his class in the first week because he did nothing but rant confusingly. However, I'm glad I didn't drop his class because his lectures are amazing and very interesting. There are only 2 exams and 1 easy paper, but attendance is mandatory. He is a good prof but not a great people person.

I love this guy! I had him for more than one class, and he is so understanding and chill.  He's the man. If you are going through a bad time, he is so understanding and doesn't put unnecessary pressure on you. He will do his best to work with you.

The professor really knows what he is teaching. The 2 exams are pretty much based on the lecture rather than the textbook. Make sure you go to the lectures and take good notes. The paper is also pretty straightforward too. by the way, he absolutely HATES cellphones so just don't use it during class.

An incredible lecturer with a vast knowledge of the art world. Even if you have zero interest in art history, he will get you interested. Tests and essays are easy if you show up to class as they are mostly based on the lectures rather than readings.

He's a great lecturer and I enjoyed listening his lectures. Outside of the class he was a mess. My friends and I emailed him throughout the term once or twice each and he almost never responded. I asked to meet him to review my essay and he told me to email it to him. I did and never got a response even after asking him after class one day.
Very knowledgeable on what he teach. Would spend extra time outside of class to help students who don't understand the materials. Highly recommended.
